top_comment.text:
This is a true story that happened to me back in 2012...

I got into bed where all was fine until about midnight. I woke up to 
someone knocking on the front door. I went to look through the peephole but 
there was no-one there. The same knocking was heard on the window in my 
brothers bedroom. I ran to check on him, afraid of an intruder but no-one 
was there and there was no sign of intrusion. My brother was fine, so I 
went back to my room, when I heard rattling on my window. I locked the 
window and ignored it. I fell back asleep but at about 4am, I woke up to 
smell perfume. I knew it wasn't my parents perfume. It smelt like my 
grandmother's perfume. The only thing was... my grandmother died in 2007....

We have since moved houses﻿

I got one for you. So two years ago, I was sleeping over at my friend' 
house and it was pretty late. My friend's dad wanted us to be in bed at 
12:00 a.m and it was 3:00 a.m at the time. My friend decided that he wanted 
to use the bathroom. So he does. As I'm waiting for him to come back, I 
hear what sounds like two people talking. I dismissed it and thought it was 
just his parents talking. He came back and I asked him.

Me: "Hey, Is your mom still awake?"
Friend: "No. Why?"
Me: "I could have sworn I heard someone talking. Are you sure?" "Like are 
you positive?"
Friend: "DUDE, NO ONE'S AWAKE!!!!"

I haven't gone to his house since then.

me. My dad use to tell me stories about this one guy who was a good friend 
of my dad's dad (lil confusing there). This guy was a Vietnam war vet and 
not some guy you'd wanna Fuck with...but that's a different story. Anyways, 
this guy bought a house with his wife and when they went to the upstairs 
closer they found an old wedding dress hanging there. Feel days after Shit 
started to get weird. Things where in different places, voices where heard, 
and most of all foot steps where heard at night upstairs where the dress

My story is the scariest:




I was somewhere around the age of 10 and it was Easter day, 4/20. (yes, 
Easter was on that day this year,) I woke up and after a few minutes of 
looking around i realized that is was Easter morning. i looked at my clock 
and it read 6.30 a.m. i ran into my parents room to wake them up from 
excitement only to realize that they were not there. i thought it was no 
big deal and that they're probably just cooking breakfast. i ran downstairs 
and through the hallway only to find my parents hanging from the ceiling by 
their toes. both of them had their mouths wide open. startled, i walked 
closer to find 6 dime bags of weed in each of their mouths. out of the 
corner of my eye, i saw a big scary old man looking at me as i got the dime 
bags out of my parents mouth. he walked up to me, bong in hand, and said, 
"i see you've found my present for you, wanna go and get high?" i happily 
accepted, and we went into my room, and got high.﻿

our house and keeps out all the evil spirits. I believe in ghosts but I'm 
not sure if this story is true, but it gives me peace of mind. ﻿

top_comment.text:
One time, I went on a vacation with my family. We just arrived at our hotel 
and checked in as you should do, then we took the elevator 2 floors up. I 
had been carrying the heaviest suitcases so I was behind everyone. As our 
elevator opened, we walked through the hall and I heard a strange voice in 
a room not so far from ours. While my family kept on walking, I was curious 
to what it was I heard, so I stopped in front of the door. The sound was 
reminding me of a screaming girl. I decided to look into the keyhole before 
my family had gone to far. I put my suitcases down for a brief moment and 
crouched in height of the keyhole, and looked through it. To my surprise, 
all I saw was red, and the feeling was weird and as someone was watching 
me. Anyhow, I didn't think much about it and rejoined my family and we 
spent our days living in the hotel.

I did not think much about this until the day we were leaving. Once again I 
was the last one because of my suitcases. As we entered the elevator to get 
down and check out, I remembered the weird room I just passed by but I 
couldn't check the keyhole again because it was too late. As we approached 
to check out, I asked the woman working:
''Do you know who is living in Room 126?'', this is the room I heard the 
weird voice from.
She gave me a straight-forward answer:
''There is currently no one living there. No one is allowed to spend their 
nights there, because a girl died mysteriously in that room.''
I did not want to say I heard a screaming girl, because I was scared at 
this point, but I was still curious:
''I inspected the room by looking at the keyhole and only noticed something 
red, why is that?''.
The woman looked at me, stunned, and after she told me the answer I 
immediately dropped my suitcases and ran out of the hotel out of fright:
''The girl that died had red eyes'', she said.﻿

top_comment.text:
I have a few... Well start with the one that actually happened to me, the 
next ones are ones family and family friends have told me.

The other night whilst I was watching YouTube videos on my phone, Siri 
popped up without me touching my phone. A few seconds later, words starting 
splaying on the users side. I was so freaked out I didn't give it time to 
finish I closed Siri immediately, only noticing two words "suck my"

These next two are ones I hear every year at Easter (long tradition of 
going bunyip hunting and hearing scary stories) I'm telling them from first 
person but yeah.

1. When I was younger I had a teacher who I was very close with. One day 
she came to school very tired. I asked her what was wrong and she said 
"there's been creepy things going on in my house. So that night my friend 
and I went to spend the night. And she took us into the kitchen and sat us 
down at the table. At exactly 12am the back door opened all on its own, 
muddy foot prints walked to the sink, stopped, went back and the door 
closed. We were both really creeped out by now so we decided to stay 
another night to see if it happened again. But this time we locked the 
door. It happened again, once the door had closed I went to check it... It 
was locked. A few years later the teacher was renovating the house and she 
had a wall knocked down to find a room she didn't know about. And inside 
the room was the skeleton of a man. It turns out the man's wife had killed 
him and hid him in the room. And the creepy occurrence was his soul 
replaying what he did every day, going out to water the garden coming in 
and having a drink then going back out. 

2. A few years ago, when my friend had just gotten married they had moved 
into an old house. A few months after the wedding the wife went away to 
visit her sister and my friend invited me to stay the night. So I came over 
and we slept in the same bed (it was cold and winter) and at 2am the bed 
started moving, not because of us, but on its own! We were definitely 
freaked out! So the next night we stayed up and watched the bed. It started 
dragging itself! We later found out that a youngish woman had died in that 
house! But we never got an explanation for the bed. 

This final story is one my cousin told me about her grandmother on the 
other side of her family. I'll be telling it in the way my cousin did. 

When my grandma was young, she lived in a house with her parents and 
siblings. But every now and then she would stay with her grandparents in an 
old house from the earlier days of Australia. Now every night she slept 
with the door closed. And on the back of the door was a full length mirror. 
However one night my grandma forgot to close the door, and woke up in the 
middle of the night to see a ghostly figure of what looked like a male 
convict at the end of the hall. As if sensing her, the ghost turned around 
and started heading for my grandma's room. My grandma, scared out of her 
wits, quickly got up and closed the door. She didn't see the ghost again 
that night. However when she asked her grandmother about it, the 
grandmother said "it's an old house, but that's why there are mirrors on 
the doors, the ghosts can't get through them if they're not on the 
reflective side." And my grandma never slept with the door open ever again.


I'm not sure if the three that weren't my experience are true but I can 
tell you the first one is 1000000000% true.﻿
top_comment.author: NerdySamSays

Here is a true story that I will remember till the day I die, one night 
many years ago, when I was about 9 or ten, I rented the movie "Secret agent 
Cody banks 2" (I'm pretty sure that was the name of the movie), anyways I 
wanted my sister to watch it with me so I let her sleep in my room on my 
bed and I slept on an air mattress in the floor, so after the movie ended 
my sister and I both fell asleep but a few hours later I woke up and all I 
heard was the music on the title screen of the movie and Cody banks 
(Malcolm in the middle guy) picture, nothing out of the ordinary, but when 
the music was about to loop over again I heard a males voice say my name, 
at this point I was already pretty scared, so I whispered my sisters name 
and then the voice said "She can't hear you", then I jump up and start 
shaking my sister and saying her name trying to wake her up, eventually she 
does and and I tell her what happened and she turns off the DVD player, 
that's the most scared I've ever been in my life.﻿

top_comment.text:
When I was a child of four or five, I guess I had an overactive imagination 
like most children did at that age. Anyhow, I had most of the normal fears. 
I had to have my closet closed at night so that I wouldn't see the dark 
shapes of my clothing in the darkness, and I always jumped into bed so that 
nothing could grab me from underneath while the lights were out. However, I 
had one fear that wasn't quite as standard for a child. I had a very 
distinct fear of a man that would stand outside my door at night and wait 
for me to go to sleep. When I closed my eyes, I could see him. A dark 
silhouette of man just standing, still and waiting. It terrified me because 
I didn't know what he wanted to do. Because of my fears I started to lose a 
lot of sleep. I would be up half the night afraid of the man outside my 
door. I would sleep in very late, be exhausted during the day, and always 
beg my parents to let me stay up later because I was afraid of going to 
bed. Eventually it got to the point where I knew that I needed to do 
something about it. My other fears were easily enough solved. I was already 
closing the closet door and turning out the light next to my bed last so I 
didn't have to worry, but the man was different. The monsters under my bed 
and in the closet were the typical kind of imaginary nighttime monsters 
that wanted to jump out and grab you, so merely avoiding them through my 
regular methods was enough to put me at ease. The man was different though. 
He didn't want me to see him. He wanted me to go to sleep without noticing 
him, and that's what made him so terrifying to me.

 I told my parents about the man, and they told me that he wasn't real and 
that I should stop worrying about him, but I couldn't. I kept losing sleep 
and I kept seeing the man when I closed my eyes. One night though, I came 
up with a solution. I left the door open before getting into bed. That may 
seem strange, but I thought it out for a long time before doing it. If I 
left the door open, then I would be able to see out into the hallway to 
make sure that the man wasn't there long enough to get to sleep. It would 
leave me vulnerable once I was asleep, but my parents had told me I was 
just imagining him, so it wouldn't do me any harm once I was asleep. On top 
of that, even if he was real, a closed door with no lock wasn't going to do 
much to stop him from getting to me. With all this in mind, I left the door 
open at night and it worked. I didn't see the man outside my door when I 
closed my eyes anymore, and I stared into the darkness until I fell to 
sleep. A couple of times I thought I saw some movement or shifting in the 
shadows, but as soon as I blinked it was gone, and I chalked it up to the 
same imagination that had dreamed up the man in the first place.

Over time, I forgot all of my fears, but my nighttime routine for dealing 
with them remained the same out of habit. I would always leave my door open 
at night, and I told my parents not to close it because it bothered me. A 
couple of years later, my sister said she saw the back of a dark figure 
looming through hallway when she got up to go to the bathroom. Looking back 
on it, I realize that the bathroom is between my room and hers, but at the 
time I paid her childish ramblings no heed with the man that stood outside 
my door almost entirely forgotten. A year or two after that, my dad said he 
saw a tall dark figure dart into the toy room in the basement. He followed 
it and flicked on the lights to find that nobody was there. The toy room 
has no windows, and only the one door, so there was nowhere for it to go, 
but whoever it was had seemingly vanished into thin air. The story 
interested me, since my dad was never one to tell even the smallest of 
lies, but again I made no connection between it and the man who stood 
outside my door so many years ago.

One day, I was heading off to school when I saw a pale white face watching 
me from the door of my house out of the corner of my eye. I looked back at 
it to see nothing. Dismissing it immediately, I went off to school without 
incident. When I came back home, I started to see the face watching me 
again. Every once in a while I would spy it, but it would disappear 
immediately. I thought that it was just my brain playing tricks on me, 
since the image was already in my head. I payed so little mind to the 
hallucinations that I didn't even tell a single person about them. The only 
real oddity was that I would only see the faces in my house... That was 
until I had one of my friends over. We were sitting in the basement in what 
used to be the toy room. I was looking something up on the computer that 
was now positioned in the room, opposite to the closet. The closet was open 
just a foot or two, and my friend was spinning around on a chair next to 
me, waving his feet absently. This meant that he had a quick glimpse into 
the closet every couple of seconds. After a short while, he jumped off of 
the chair with a screech, and whirled to face the closet. I asked him what 
was wrong and he pointed to the closet, swearing to me that he saw a pale 
white face smiling at him from the closet. At fist I was ready to laugh it 
off as him either playing a prank on me or getting wrapped up in my 
hallucinations, but then I remembered that I hadn't told him about them 
yet, nor anyone else for that matter. It was illogical. There was no way he 
could have hallucinated the same thing as me without at least hearing a 
description of the hallucination first. For the first time in years, I was 
terrified. He went home and I went to bed that night, still trying to make 
sense of the ordeal. Before going to bed, I made a decision that seemed 
minor at the time. I decided, for the first time since I was a toddler, to 
sleep with my door closed. I don't know what it was, but I thought that 
maybe it would offer me a little bit of protection if there really was 
something in my house. After a while, I started to doze off. It was then 
that I heard a loud thump on my door, followed moments later by some 
scratching noises. I flicked on the light next to my bed, thoroughly 
spooked, when I remembered that my family had a dog that would scratch on 
doors when she wanted to be let in to a room. I sighed in relief and was 
deciding whether or not to bother getting up and letting her in when I 
heard another noise. There was a soft click of a door handle being grasped 
firmly, followed by a loud violent rattling. The door handle turned back 
and forth sporadically, jerking and twisting violently for several seconds 
before suddenly stopping and leaving me in deadly silence. I sleep with my 
door closed now.﻿

top_comment.text:
I live in a rented apartment. One night, I heard sweeping from the 
neighbor's room (thin wall). At first, I thought nothing, but it strikes my 
curiosity as why the heck would someone swept their floor at 4:00 am? As I 
am staying awake through the night surfing the internet, the swept 
continues. I notice that the sweeping is always done 5 times at the 
interval of 3 seconds. Sometimes, the sweeping is replaced by banging 
sounds, kinda like a wooden bed constantly hitting the wall of my 
neighbor's room, also with the same pattern of 5 times at 3 seconds 
interval. Sometimes, these mysterious incidents happens in daylight, when 
my neighbors are not in he house. Until now, I still can't figure what's 
the meaning behind the sweeping sound. I chose to ignore these incidents 
since no harm is done to me. Compared to what happened to me during my 
schooldays in a boarding school, this is merely a creepy joke.﻿

comments.author: LittleLulubee

comments.text:
I never bother to investigate deeply about my school death history. 
Sometimes it's better to not know the truth. Besides, I've already 
graduated. Well, my school is build in front of an interstate road. There's 
many accident happened there despite the road is perfectly straight. From 
what I've heard, most of the hardcore ghost already left before I got into 
that school. Now, I rarely encountered any supernatural incident. The last 
incident happened at my parent house when I am digging a well with my dad. 
Somehow around fifty small bottle suddenly appeared around the house, which 
each of them contain a sheet of paper with somekind of curse written on it. 
We somehow broke a curse enchantment while digging a well, I guess.
comments.author: Soran Lioncore

comments.text:
+Soran Lioncore That is so creepy!! Do you think they were demons or 
something? The one with the Buffalo head doesn't sound like a regular 
ghost. The woman could have been, though. Did you ever research the history 
of the school? I wonder if any traumatic deaths happened there. Have you 
always had these kind of experiences? Was that the only time you saw them, 
at the school? I totally agree with what you say about not panicking. Your 
fear weakens you and they feed off of it. I stayed in a haunted house once, 
and a bunch of things happened. One time I was asleep and I heard 3 very 
loud knocks on the bedroom door (which was about 3 feet from my head). It 
startled me awake and I said "What?" Because I thought it was my friend. 
Nobody opened the door, but  immediately after I spoke I heard 3 loud 
knocks again. So I said "What do you want?". Then for a 3rd time, the 
knocks. As soon as it happened the 3rd time, I thought to myself "Whatever, 
it's just the ghosts" (because I already knew the house was haunted). I 
looked at the clock and rolled over back to sleep. The knocking stopped 
(later my friend verified she had left the house before that incident and 
she had never knocked). My theory was that the goal of the ghost was to 
scare me. Since I didn't get scared, they gave up.
comments.author: LittleLulubee

comments.text:
Well, most of the time it's just your common shadow people. The first time 
it happened I saw a long-haired woman dressed in yellow t-shirt (which 
looks like she just got hit by a truck) sticking it's hand into my stomach. 
It doesn't feel hurt, but I have a bad feeling that something bad will 
happened if I lower my guard. Each time it happened, I can barely breath 
and felt something trying to enter me normally for 30 minutes ( the longest 
is an hour). I don't memorize any holy scripture perfectly, so I merely 
continue to repeatedly uttered God's name which is barely audible until it 
goes away. The last time I got sleep paralysis in school, I got two attack 
in a row, which is a long-haired buffalo with a man body and a black smoke 
that resemble human. Each of my schoolmates has their own personal 
experience. One of junior got chased by one and I once borrow my friend 
cellphone to watch a movie alone at 2:00 am only to realized that it also 
watching the movie with me. From my experience, it's best to not panic and 
try to calm down. They want us to believe they can hurt us, so the moment 
we start to give in is the moment they gain influence to our mind.
comments.author: Soran Lioncore

comments.text:
+Soran Lioncore Wow, that's scary. It sounds like you have alot of courage- 
good for you. What did they look like? Did they bother anyone else at the 
school? How did it feel when they tried to enter your body, how long did 
each incident last? What did you do to stop them? I'm just curious.
comments.author: LittleLulubee

comments.text:
Well, it's not severely haunted. During my third year at that school, 
somehow "they" start to haunt me. I got sleep paralysis at least once a 
week back then, and when it happen, one of them will try to enter me. 
Whenever it happens, I have a tug-of-war against it to prevent them from 
taking over my body. Sure, it was scary, but I never give in. After two 
years passed, they stopped trying from taking over me. I saw them 
sometimes, but I ignored them. I believe that they're only powerful against 
us as long as we feared them. Until now, I occasionally encountered these 
mysterious incidents and I just ignored them. Honestly, they can't actually 
harm us if we just stop fearing them so much and man-up.

Now, this is my story.

I remember when I was about 4-5 years old and I lived in Kentucky. Me and 
my family lived in this house I can't remember where, but when I went to 
sleep, I always dreamed about this little girl that was about my age. Her 
hair was black, and she always wore this hospital gown with small blue dots 
all over it. She stared at me with a surprised look on her face. But, the 
odd thing was that she didn't have any eyes. Her eye sockets were 
completely black, like staring into an empty void. When we moved to 
Florida, I've never seen the little girl ever since. I haven't told anyone 
about these events ever since.

I SWEAR TO MY LIFE that this happened! Not the Creepypasta bullshit that 
you read on the internet!﻿

top_comment.text:
So around the time when I was still living with my parents there was a 
month when I had to sleep in the library of our house because my room was 
being painted. Our library is like a small second floor on the back of the 
house and you can only access it from outside. It is completely 
disconnected from the rest of the house, even if you open the windows you 
cannot hear anything coming from the house or from the yard.

So one night I was sleeping and I had just woken up because I wanted to go 
to the bathroom, but could not make up my mind as to whether going or not 
because I am a lazy ass. While I laid sideways on my bed I started to hear 
and feel a deep breathing on the back of my neck. There was no one else in 
the library with me, so I instantly freaked out. It felt as if someone was 
crouched next to me, breathing on my neck. I instantly paralyzed and wished 
for it to be over, and after a few seconds I heard steps walking away from 
the bed and into a corner of the room. I refused to open my eyes and tried 
to scream, but I couldn't find my voice. And suddenly the thing on the 
corner of the room started to cry and sob in a terrific way, it didn't stop 
until I could get out of my stupor and scream with all my force and when I 
did it vanished. After that I let my dog get into the room because I didn't 
want to sleep alone anymore. He walked straight towards the corner where 
the thing had stood crying and stared at it, his ears up and his body 
completely rigid in alert. He didn't answer me when I called his 
name. After that I have never had the courage to step inside that library 
alone again.﻿

When I was about nine, my mom was at work, and my brother was taking a 
shower. I was sitting on the couch watching TV, minding my own business. In 
the corner of my eye, I saw a figure opening the refrigerator, and I 
thought it was my brother. I didn't look at the figure, because I didn't 
want to. The figure closed the refrigerator, and left. My brother got out 
of the shower, and I asked if he came out and opened the refrigerator, but 
he said he never even got out of the shower. 

I still live in the same house, and every now and then, I see foggy black 
figures in the hallway.

top_comment.text:
I have a creepy story. Once, I went to stay at a friend's place up in 
Newcastle, a bit north of Sydney in NSW, Australia. One night I was there, 
I awoke at about 2:30 in the morning to soft sounds of sobbing coming from 
within the room. Once my eyes were opened enough to see about the room, I 
saw what appeared to be a young girl standing at the end of my bed in a 
white dress. Still in my half-asleep state, I ask "Are you okay?" 
Immediately after that, all sound seemed to vanish from the room. Not just 
her sobbing stopped, but the sound of wind and other ambient noise just 
ended. Then I started to find it hard to breathe. Her head, which has been 
bowed the entire time, slowly lifts up to look at me. There were black pits 
with tiny white specks where her eyes should have been. Her mouth stretches 
unnaturally wide, and she screams, moments before simply vanishing. The 
scream was so loud, it not only woke up my friend's family in the house, 
but the neighbours who called the police, thinking something has gone very 
wrong.

Needless to say, I got out of that room right quick, and spent the rest of 
the night on the couch. The next morning, we all went back into the room, 
and we saw small footprints imprinted in the carpet of the room that didn't 
match anyone in the house. Everybody's feet were too large to have made the 
footprints. To add to that, they were right where the girl was standing.﻿

top_comment.text:
When I was 12ish, I walked out of my room in the middle of the night 
to go upstairs to p, and saw the family dog doing what I can only describe 
as playing with an invisible person in the downstairs family room. 
 Spinning circles, wagging her tail, sitting and pawing up at empty air, 
never taking her eyes off the wall 10 feet in front of her.  She was 
completely silent, never growled, never barked, and I recall being more 
confused than scared at the time.  I harsh whispered her name in the dark 
with something like "Scooter, WTF are you doing?!?" and she immediately 
stopped and ran over to me, with that sheepish look dogs get when they are 
feeling guilty about something bad they've done.  To this day I have no 
idea what was going on.  Doggy dementia, sleepwalking, stroking out?  Not a 
clue.  I can tell you it sure LOOKED like my dog was playing with a ghost, 
and vice versa.
     Still raises the hair on the back of my neck to remember it, almost 30 
years later.﻿

When I was 9, I heard something stomping on the house's stairs, thinking it 
was my little brother, I checked out the stairs, though nothing was there, 
I kept hearing the sound.  After a while, I yelled for my mom, causing the 
stomping to stop.  My mom screamed and ran to get me of the stairs.  Three 
years later I asked my mom why she did it.  She told me there was was 
someone down there.  It still scares me, it's been 23 years.
comments.author: ThatBlueGem 2014

comments.text:
I used to live in an apartment in southern California when I was about 10 
or 11 years old, that I'm sure had something weird going on. My mom would 
always poke her head in our bedroom door to check on my brother and I 
before she went to bed, and i could always hear her walking down the 
hallway before she opened the door. After a few months of living there, I 
started to hear footsteps (after she'd gone to bed) coming down the hall 
and stopping at the bedroom door, but it wouldn't open. I asked her about 
it and she told me that she had already gone to sleep by that time. Then, 
it started to get spooky. There were nights that i would wake up around 
2-3am and i could hear the TV on in the living room. I'd go in there and 
the TV would just be on, at high volume when i knew that i had turned it 
off. One day, my mom and I came home from the store, and we expected my 
brother to be just getting home from his friend's house. I walked into our 
bedroom and noticed the closet door was open and just as I though it was 
strange, a beach ball flew out of the closet and missed my face by a few 
inches. I thought it was my brother messing around so i opened the closet 
and there was nobody in there. My brother came home about ten minutes 
later. About a week after that, i was walking down the same hallway when 
the glass dome around a light fixture on the ceiling came loose and barely 
missed me before shattering on the floor. Other weird stuff happened there, 
but after we moved, it all stopped. I never did find out if anything bad 
happened there or if anyone died in the apartment, but i still get chills 
thinking about that place.
comments.author: CtrlAltPhreak

I have a story, and yes it is true:

I was haunted as a child from what my mom said I called "Shadow Guy". From 
what i remember he was as tall as me and was kind of like a shadow version 
of me, (from when I was one to about four). I remember him showing up when 
I was alone. The two most vivid memories of him are when my mom asked me to 
get something from the office, so I walked over to the office (which was 
dark) he showed up, he copied every movement I made, I yelled at him and 
started crying but he kept mimicking me and getting closer and when I ran 
to the kitchen he followed me. The second things I remember was some nights 
I was unable to leave my room after I fell asleep, the windows and door was 
gone and I was enclosed in pretty much a big box. One time when I was 
alone, under the table a saw a mutilated corpse of a blond woman. One of 
the days I was able to get out of my room at night and I went to my parents 
room, as I lay on the bed I looked outside the open door to see some 
floating kitchen ware. The one thing I don't remember but my mom told me 
was how I got the scar on my knee, I was playing with my Hot-wheels and he 
ran it into me hard.﻿

top_comment.text:
By the way, There is this thing, I don't know what it's called in English. 
But basicly it means your half asleep and half awake at the same time. So 
you're still dreaming but you are also awake and able to see for example 
you bedroom. This combined with nightmares can cause some heavy panic and 
anxiety attacks. I have suffered from this aswell ("not" the attacks) I was 
just lying in my bed and saw a sort of clown faced poltergeist bending over 
me grabbing my arm tight and bendig further down. Me being able to realise 
it is a dream and trying to convince myself I am stronger then him. Unable 
to move, hearing my own heavy breathing and shaking of fear I try to make 
myself wake up. After a minute or so of intense mental battling I manage to 
win and see the clownfaced thing dissappear vaguely, the grip on my arm is 
released and I can move to sit-up straight in my bed. I hope it is indeed 
just a dream, because if I'm really being haunted, believing in ghosts 
would weaken my position in this fight since it happens occassionally. Just 
wanted to share this and hear others opinions on it. (sorry if my English 
isn't 100% correct lol)﻿

comments.text:
I've had something sort of like this happen. So I have always had a FEAR, 
not just a hatred of bugs. This may not seem scary but to me it was pure 
torture. So anyway, it started out with me just hearing a faint buzzing 
noise then out of the blue a ton of weird bugs show up, like some of them 
were like huge lightning bugs crawling on the ceiling, and a huge swarm of 
gnat like things flying around, there were also the lightning bug things 
falling from underneath the desk and climbing onto my bed, with the swarm, 
it would fly all around my room, and lead right into my face, it was so 
like, in detail, that I could feel the wind from their wings, and the sting 
of their bite. So I freaked out, and turned on the light. It all vanished. 
I'm not able to sleep with the light on, and when I'm really tired I 
hallucinate, so I got back into bed with the lights off. After like 10 
seconds, the bugs were back. Think that's weird?? Here's the weirdest part: 
I was pretty much petrified after that, and when ALL the bugs went onto the 
bed, I seriously said NO GO BACK out loud, and it being my mind, it went to 
the end of the bed and sat there. It came back after a bit, and I said NO 
and it disappeared. This is one of my creepiest experiences!!

top_comment.text:
When I was in the fifth grade, I went to the bathroom alone during class, 
so no one was out in the halls. I got done with my business, washed my 
hands and started fixing my hair to waste time so I didn't have to go to 
class for a while. When I looked back up in the mirror, I saw this figure 
behind me. It was the outline of a man, few inches taller than me. It had 
no face, but purple and blue sort of swirling around, like a hole. It's 
hard to explain, but it looked terrifying. I stood, shocked and 
immobilized, I swear my legs felt like lead. Whatever it was said "Psst, 
come here!" And when I turned around, it was leaned over behind the corner 
going into the girls room and said "Follow me!" And when I stepped into the 
halls, I couldn't see a thing. It was all silent, too, real creepy. It 
couldn't have been anyone, i would have seen them running or ducking into 
the boys bathroom, or into the only classroom near the bathrooms, which was 
the one I was in at the period. I still have no idea what it was.﻿

top_comment.text:
I've been visited by the shadow too specially when I was younger around 
14-17 years old (I'm 22 now). I always thought I had experienced an 
otherworldly visit, as I grew older those experiences slowed in frequency 
to a range of about twice per year from being more than 10 times per year. 
What I find strange is that my most recent experiences did not have any 
shadow of a man watching me sleep they were rather a sensation of fear. I 
eventually started doing research and sharing my experience only to find 
out that it had a medical explanation which was the so called "Sleep 
Paralysis" which described exactly my sensations of fear and vivid 
hallucinations. Sleep paralysis takes place when the brain wakes up but the 
body remains asleep making you unable to move a finger or scream (this 
happens when you are under constant strees or deprived of sleep). What 
intrigues me and which to this moment I have been unable to explain is why 
do people who share my same experience describe seeing a big tall shadow 
staring at them? is it a coincidence we all hallucinate with the same 
shadow? why does it have to be that shadow of a tall devilish man? why not 
a tiger or a spider per say? and why does the tall devilish shadow of a man 
or demon  has dissappeared from my sleep paralysis scenarios since I 
discovered it's scientific explanation? those are the things I'm yet unable 
to explain and I doubt they have an explanation. ﻿
top_comment.author: Kalvin40

comments.text:
(Had to go deep into the bowels of the comment section to find this again) 
I am 14. I have very sporadically occurring bouts of sleep paralysis. This 
has been happening for the better half of two years now. However, I have 
never seen a dark shadow of a man. It could very well be shadows 
interpreted into the things people most likely don't want to see in a 
vulnerable state. Once you figured out what it was, it probably reduced the 
urgency you felt about being paralyzed, and your mind may have thought more 
rationally towards whatever it was you saw, resulting in the absence of the 
shadow. 

To be honest, I'm not sure why you would want to hear about someone's case 
with seeing a giant spider shadow. I'd prefer the man shadow.

Sorry if my original paragraph went a little off topic. I'm not sure if it 
made sense or not. I tend to go off track a little when I type.
comments.author: ubersp00nerpkc

Remember when you woke up in the middle of the night without a reason? 
Well, there's an 80% chance someone or something is watching you, that's 
because our brain reacts when we feel a presence near. If we're awake and 
we feel a presence, we suddenly feel scared, and if we're asleep, the brain 
reacts by waking us up, alerting us of the possible danger.


Well, goodnight :) ﻿

top_comment.text:
It was my last year at my 70-year-old Elementary school, so we obviously 
had a grade 8 graduation and everything.

After the graduation, I stayed behind to help clean up with my Language 
teacher, and she told me to hold on while she gets the scissors (there was 
tape and glue stuck to the walls).
So I was left alone in the Gym, until the door opened, and in walked in a 
teacher I've never seen before.
Since I only went to that school for a year, I thought it was a teacher I'd 
never seen before, or someone's guardian looking for their child.
The guy was very old, and congratulated me for graduating, then said "You 
remind me of a student I had when this school opened."
And I was surprised, and asked him who he was, and he said he was the 
founder of the school, and I got a chill down my spine and an uncomfortable 
feeling.
Then, he just left the Gym, and when he opened the door, in walked in my 
Language teacher.

He went right through her.

I was so startled, I said that my mom asked me to come home right away, 
said goodbye, then ran away from that school.
Maybe I was overreacting or didn't see stuff properly but whatever.﻿

This not a ghost thing but pretty cool though and kind of creepy. At one 
point in my life I was able to really concentrate and repeatedly say to 
myself 'Im going to dream tonight, I'm going to dream tonight...'. Not only 
did I dream, but i was in full control in my dream. If I wanted to fly, I 
would jump into the air and fly. I could do what I wanted. It had its 
limitations. It only lasted for a short while. Then i stopped doing it. 
Maybe because I knew it was possible and got bored of it. I found out later 
that this is very possible and there are even instructions on Google on how 
to do it. Just think its cool that I managed to figure it out on my own.﻿

comments.text:
+Duela Dent I don't ^_^


Personally, I don't believe in souls or life force or whatever, or an 
afterlife. I prefer to look at the science of things. Take for example, 
life. It's a series of chemical reactions. Our bodies move using muscles; 
we think by our cells interpreting electrical signals in different ways.

For this reason I don't believe in ghosts or any form of afterlife. I 
believe that when those chemical reactions stop we die, and because we 
can't think, we just stop. We're not awake in some blackness; we just can't 
think, so we don't see, hear, taste, smell, or touch. We just stop.
comments.author: DookCraftZookdook1

top_comment.text:
When I was 7, and we moved into this new house, I immediately ran to a door 
and just stood there, pointing at it and repeating "What's down there?" I 
hadn't opened the door, so it looked like a closet, but it really was a 
basement. When my mom told me there was nothing down there, I whispered 
"There's people down there screaming with their heads cut off"
Throughout living in that house, we all had supernatural experiences, my 
sister's bed levitating, the shower curtains moving up and down, someone 
climbing into bed but not actually being there, a kid running around back 
and fourth from the kitchen to the hall at night, and for me specifically, 
moaning... creepy creepy moaning...
When mom used one of those spirit boards, we found out there were three 
spirits: a woman, a little boy, and a man with scary aura﻿

top_comment.text:
When I was, we lived with my grandparents. My parents and grandparents 
slept downstairs and my sister and I slept upstairs in the nursery. We had 
a "nurse maid" (we called her that later after hearing the term on tv). She 
was a very pretty lady in her mid-twenties named Violet. She never spoke, 
but we just knew that was her name somehow. She would sit in the rocking 
chair every night humming, never singing words, just humming. Sometimes she 
would hug us and finger comb our hair until we fell asleep, some times she 
would even rock us to sleep during a bad thunderstorm. I remember her just 
as real as any other adults in my life. I remember the feel and scent of 
her skin, the tone of her humming, tunes of her songs, and even the rhythm 
she would comb my hair. My sister and I legitimately thought she was a 
member of the family even though she never left the nursery, my parents 
assumed she was just an imaginary friend or a dream. Then after my grandpa 
died she disappeared. 
When I was about 10 my grandma, my sister, and I were looking though old 
family photos and we saw a black and white picture of Violet from 1943. 
Both me and my sister, pointed at it at the same time and said "That's 
Violet!" And my grandma, who wasn't even surprised, said "Yes, do you 
recognize her?" 
My sister said, "Of course, she was our nanny, wasn't she?"
Grandma shook her head, apparently, my grandpa had a wife before my 
grandma, she was a very kind woman who loved kids and always wanted one. 
She had two miscarriages before her third pregnancy where she had finally 
made it to her third trimester, she was so excited and had been preparing 
the nursery for the baby when she went into pre-term labor and bled to 
death. But just because she couldn't have her own kids doesn't mean she 
wouldn't watch out for her husband's babies. My grandma would often see a 
mist hovering above my mom and uncle's cribs when they were babies, and 
they used to always talk about "Violet from the upstairs bedroom" when they 
were young as well. And even when my grandma was pregnant she would feel a 
warm, comforting embrace protecting her. She's convinced that Violet had 
stuck around to keep the new children safe. But then when my grandpa died 
she moved on to be with him.﻿
top_comment.author: RavenclawGirl29

top_comment.text:
When i was like 10, i called my mom on my cell phone. When she answered, i 
didn't hear her voice. I said,
"Mom?"
"Oh, you want your mommy?"
It sounded almost demonic, so i thought it was my sister playing a prank.
"Where's mom?"
"Oh you want mom? You want your mommy?" 
That's when i hung up and saw that the number i entered wasn't there. It 
said 666-6666. I was SO scared. The creepy part is, when i told my dad, he 
said "oh that's weird." He didn't even have a big reaction, but i was soo 
scared. This incident stopped me from buying a new phone till i was 16. God 
that will haunt me. Don't believe me fine, but please tell me if this has 
happened to anyone else.﻿

at her with an evil unnaturally large smile. She said it was like his jam 
was unhinged. My mom said "What the fuck?" jokingly (she never takes 
anything seriously.) Then, my dad broke off into little squares and

this, she looked truly horrified and she kept looking behind her. Now every

top_comment.text:
Everyone else is sharing their scary story, so why not?

In 2010 when I was about 11 or 12 I always slept with my door open, it 
scared me to have it shut for some reason. Anyways, at around 4am I woke up 
to go to the bathroom, but before I got up I heard a something that sounded 
like my mom's military pants rubbing together when she walked. I was used 
to my mom's weird ever changing schedule, so I thought nothing of it except 
for the fact that it sounded like she was running. I was a little freaked 
out so I waited to go to the bathroom which was just across the hall. My 
dog was peacefully watching me on my bed not worried about a thing, this 
always made me feel better. So I go to the bathroom and while I was in 
there I heard the running sound again, I was freaking out so I waited in 
there for a while longer. When I was back in my room my dog decided that 
she was going to go sleep in the living room instead, not wanting to be 
alone I followed her to sleep on the couch with her. How I was positioned I 
could see down the dark hall, when I looked into the dark I saw a bright 
white face floating about 8 feet high (we had 10 foot ceilings) looking at 
me with its long skeletal face. I was frozen in fear so I pretended not to 
see it, although my dog didn't even react to it. When I woke in the morning 
my mom asked why I slept on the couch, I told her I wanted to sleep with my 
dog (Black Labrador, big dog=safe). I asked her if she was up at all last 
night for work or something, she replied that she had the entire weekend 
off and didn't even use the bathroom that night. 

I now sleep with my door shut...﻿

top_comment.text:
I don't think I have any personal spoopy stories that can't be explained 
with something logical, but for a while I lived with a really friendly 
spirit, who we (me and my friends) ended up calling Carl, because the night 
they met him, one of them said the name Carl and he responded to it. At 
first Carl would just make lots of noise on the stairs at my house (which 
at the time frightened me), I told my friends about this a day that they 
came over, so they were kind of teasing me until we were going to bed and 
Carl started playing and freaking them out as well (this is when we named 
him). After that I wasn't afraid of him at all anymore, even though he was 
constantly being a pest and knocking stuff over, opening my drawers, and 
the like (he never did break anything, though).
 One time a few months later I had another friend over and we were home 
alone and she said that she wanted some pizza pockets. A few minutes later 
we could hear the microwave running. Sure enough, when we went down there, 
inside the microwave was a plate of pizza pockets...
Not to mention the countless times I would wake up with a wicked cough and 
find a glass of water next to my bed...

Sadly, Carl disappeared about a year or so ago. I really miss him, his 
shenanigans were oddly... comforting...

However, for a month or so,  there was another spirit, this time a girl, 
who would sing to me when I was having a rough night. She would always sing 
Amazing Grace and had a very pretty voice. But she didn't stay for long.﻿

When I was little I was staying the night at my mom's house and I didn't 
like sleeping in my room there because it creeped me out, but I was 
too embarrassed to sleep with my brothers. So my mom had me sleep with her

next to me. I could tell because he was hooked up to her oxygen tank and we 
had been in bed for hours. At one point my grandma says "boy, you'd better 
go to sleep before the boogyman gets ya" in her normal raspy southern 
voice. After she said this I realized that I had been staring at the closet 
all night and right after she stopped talking the closet door opened slowly 
but nothing came out. I guess I fell asleep after that cos I don't remember 
anything after it opened.﻿

top_comment.text:
Something happened to me that MADE me 100% believe demons are real. 
I was laying in my bed, at the point of sleep where your body is rested, 
eyes are shut, practically about to sleep but you are still aware of what's 
going on around you. I heard rustling to my right. My friend was sleeping 
on the air mattress beside me so I thought none of it. Then I heard things 
on my dresser moving (Which was to the right of my friend). I open my eyes 
to see my friend asleep on the mattress, and a black figure fiddling with 
things on my dresser. I just stared at it, not scared at all, and started 
asking it questions. 

Questions about demons and angels, heaven and hell. To which HE (which I 
found out) was answering all of them, calmly, while still fiddling with 
things on my dresser. Then I asked one question that got his attention. 
"How do people sell their souls to the devil?" It stopped. Dropped what it 
had and just stood there without saying anything for about 10 seconds. Then 
it turned around, calmly still, stepped over my friend, and was now 
standing right beside my bed, right by my shoulders. He said some things i 
don't quite remember, but then he said "Like this!" He pushed down right 
across my abdomen, by my belly button, and just kept pushing!

He pushed so hard that I could FEEL my skin & organs wrap around my spine. 
At the same time, I was hearing an unbearable sound, like the whistling in 
your ear mixed with a train speeding past you. I tried to push his hand off 
but couldn't. I "woke" up and he wasn't there. I was in a cold sweat, 
stomach in pain and I couldn't really do anything. I just stayed awake for 
a bit calming myself down then went back to sleep. The next morning, when I 
went to shower, I looked in the mirror and saw a clearly visible red line 
RIGHT where the thing had pushed. All across my stomach.. My friend heard 
nothing and to this day, I believe these beings exists. ﻿

comments.text:
+Julian Fontaine I didn't get it wrong, I was using sarcasm. And it pains 
me to say, unless we go Battlestar Galactica, we'll probably never meet the 
other life that surely exists. We're just too far away. That sucks. It 
would be interesting to know how long they held on to their myths.
On to what we do know. There isn't an established Multiverse Theory. More 
like a few working theories.  What concerns me is your phrases "just a 
theory" and "make it accepted fact". Why are you trying to discuss science 
topics? You're clearly not qualified, as evident by those comments.
I'm trying to stay calm, but "just a theory" makes me see red. I mean, it 
really pisses me off. The education system is partially to blame, but you 
have some responsibility too. We've been explaining what a Theory is for 
decades; every time you people misuse it. And still you just won't catch 
on. 
A Theory is the acme, the apex, the pinnacle of science. They are the goal, 
the target, the payoff for all the hard work. "Just a theory" is like 
saying "just everything" or "just the winner". And a Theory does not become 
a fact. No more than blue will ever become a flavor. These are introductory 
terms. Learn what they mean.
And while you're at it, familiarize yourself with the logical fallacies. 
They are the rules used to discern which evidence is valid, to determine 
what we know. The rules of the game. Start with the Argument from Ignorance 
fallacy.
Convince me you understand these concepts and we might discuss some topics. 
To be clear, I don't play chess with pigeons. I hunt them.
Thanks for the compliment, I appreciate it. I take pride in my writing. 
It's nice when it gets noticed. Even if it was only the scene from 
*Tombstone*.

comments.text:
+Julian Fontaine I've had some pretty creepy experiences brought on by 
sleep paralysis. It only happened twice in my life, thank god, but it was 
terrifying. 

One time I was awoken suddenly by the sensation that I wasn't alone. I 
couldn't move at all and I could see what appeared to be a 
black...something in the corner of my ceiling. Looked kinda like a blob. Or 
a floating smudge. I was in sheer terror, not knowing what was happening to 
me, and started to feel like I couldn't breathe. All I could do was close 
my eyes, tell myself it had to be a dream and focus on regaining my motor 
skills. It was kinda like in Kill Bill when she's in the truck trying to 
wiggle her big toe. I finally got movement back and turned the lights on 
and sat up for a few hours.


Another time, I was woken by something seemingly shoving me. I was sleeping 
on my side and it felt like something rolled me over and said something in 
my ear. I can't remember what it said, but it was something creepy. 


This all happened within a short period of time, and I was also having some 
pretty unsettling dreams, that were scary, but for no good reason. Like I 
dreamt I was in my room, and I was trying to turn the lights on but 
couldn't. Nothing worked. And my bedroom door started to open and I threw 
myself against it, holding it shut. All I knew was I couldn't let whatever 
it was in. 


Finally I had a dream where I walked into my grandfather's room and he was 
in his bed ( the bed he died in fyi) and he looked sick and he was sitting 
upright and we had a conversation, but again I can't recall what we spoke 
of. But it frightened me. 


I don't attribute these things to the paranormal tho.

I live near the forest, and one night, I saw a little game named Slender. 
Curious on the weird guy in the game, I decided to read about the 
Slenderman. My dad called me out to let the dog out. While my dog was 
sniffing around for a spot to do his job, I looked over to the forest and 
saw what looked like a white guy with a tuxedo. I didn't have my glasses so 
I couldn't see clearly, but my imagination did the work. After staring, 
terrified, for a few seconds, I hurriedly pulled my dog up onto the porch. 
After I got him inside, I turned back around, to see no one. I'm not sure 
if it my imagination, or not wearing my glasses, but I believe I saw 
someone﻿

comments.text:
+Sho Nuff
I know, and obviously so do other people. Alas, this shall be the last 
comment, so for any other readers, here are why ghosts will never be real: 
Ghosts defy the laws of physics. A pure energy being would not be cold like 
many  suggest, it would hot and burn everything in it's path. Something 
that hot would also ionize the gas around it, making it look like a 
constant light ball brighter than the surface of the Sun. There are also 
obvious logical errors. If you died and were stuck on Earth due to 
unfinished business, you would want to convince people to help you so you 
can move on, right? Instead they are always poking you, pulling off bed 
sheets, standing at the end of a hallway, it's like they are just trying to 
scare you. Oh wait, that's right- ghosts were made up to scare people. 
That's why they are always doing "scary" things, rather than intelligent 
things. Furthermore, how come ghosts only exist in certain places from 
certain times? I just think it is convenient that almost every failing 
hotel or motel all of the sudden has ghosts, or places where battles 
happened, or just big Victorian houses. Where are the cave-men ghosts? The 
medieval ghosts? On top of all of that, there are clear explanations as to 
why people see them. Beyond mental illness, pictures and videos can easily 
be faked, people can also lie. there is also the fact that if you go into a 
place THINKING it's haunted, your mind will create shadowy figures moving 
about, and you will think every little noise is a ghost. All that being 
said, there is not a shred of evidence proving in any way ghosts exist.

top_comment.text:
Now, i know no-ones going to believe this story, but it is honestly true. 

I was 7 at the time. Me and my cousin Ella were playing in the garden, my 
mother was out shopping and my father was watching tv. After half an hour 
we heard someone rustling around. We ignored it, and decided to go inside. 
We tried the door but it wouldn't open, so we started calling my father to 
help us get back in. We heard something really loud, like someone had fell 
over, but when we turned around we saw something called 'the rake' as I 
know now after investigating further, and i can honestly say we shit 
ourselves. We turned around and starting screaming and banging on the door. 
After 5 minutes of that i felt it grab my shoulder and pull me back. It did 
the same to Ella but then something unexpected happened. After he pulled us 
back (very gently) about a meter he climbed through the open window. We 
both panicked but had no idea what to do. After several minutes the door 
swung wide open and the thing clambered out. It crawled past us and turned 
round to face us and i SWEAR he was tring to smile. Then he lept over the 
back wall, and we never saw him again. He had done no harm at all to us or 
the house, but when i saw the things he'd done, i nearly cried in anger. 
Sure, he looked scary but he meant no harm at all. This memory will 
probably stay with me forever.﻿

One time, several months back, well, twice actually, I saw these two pairs 
of eyes, or what seemed to be eyes, staring at me through my window. One 
pair was white, the other red. I stared at them, but I didn't look away out 
of fear, but that's why I kept looking at them, out of anxiety and utter 
awe, bewilderment and the urge to shit bricks. I fell asleep, and they were 
gone. The next night however, I got a knock on the door. I went to check 
who it was out of annoyance, without opening it, or turning the porch light 
on. I went to the peephole, and those two same pairs of eyes were staring 
at me through them. I nearly shit myself, but I stayed there, anticipating, 
utterly anxious about these mysterious, well, thing's next moves. I stayed, 
but eventually fell asleep, but I never saw them again. I'm beginning to 
wonder what in the seven hells they were. ﻿

+Faceless well, since everyone else is sharing, I just so happen to suffer 
from the exact same thing. I dunno how old you are, but im now 13. (Turned 
13 a little over 2 months ago.) I never really realized it until earlier 
this year, but I remember little things from when I was... 5-6, like seeing 
a shadow at the window when no one was actually at the window, or hearing 
strange noises at night, even seeing things through the corner of my eye, 
even if they were just something flashing by. Now tho, as I suffer from 
other personal problems, it got to the point where I saw a man, taller than 
me, standing in the corner of my room at night. It wasnt exactly a man, 
more like a shadow, but even in the darkness of my room, I would see it. 
Only I could, even if I sleep with other people in the room. Plus, only I 
woke up. I could make out claws, but for some reason I never saw it's feet. 
I even named it. I called it Carl. Keep in mind that I'm 13, so I dont keep 
guns in my room. Anyway, carl didnt do much, but often pointed at me like 
he's gonna do something. He just stood there and pointed, sometimes 
hovering, but I still felt extremely intimidated and afraid, so I have to 
sleep with SOME kind of light in the room. I'm afraid of absolute darkness 
now, and I have to sleep with my face towards a wall, almost completely 
covered in blankets in fear of seeing him. So I feel you .-.

top_comment.text:
Well here is my personal creepy story that goes back to 2002. I was about 
19 at that time.

We were a group  of a dozen friends and one night we decided to go in the 
woods at 2AM. One of our friends was a big pussy, so we had the idea of 
hidding in the woods as we were walking without him noticing. Let him freak 
out for a minute and then jump scare him.

I got out of the group as planned and kept myself in a nice hidding spot. 
it was a full moon night so visibility was "ok" even without flash lights.

I waited for a good 5... maybe 10 minutes. I expected to hear our friend 
scream or call for us... But nothing.

I finally decided to move out of my hidding spot and rejoin with the 
group... OR find someone else at least.

I finally heard wood cracking sounds around me, like foot steps. I called 
out, but no one answered. Finally i kinda figured out that now i was the 
one being victim of the prank. And someone was fucking with me. I kepts 
hearing something going in circles around me. I acted though to make the 
point that the prank wasn't going to work on me. "Alright, i know who this 
is... Stop fucking around".

Finally, i saw a shape appearing from behind a tree. It just stepped out of 
its hidding spot and i couldn't really see who that was. I could see it was 
a guy, but it was too dark to see clearly. I said "Kevin? Is that you?" No 
answers... "David! David i know its you!" Still no answer.

Than i heard voices from far away,  "JOHN! JOHN! WHERE ARE YOU MAN?" It was 
my friends, calling me from out of the forest. The pranked had failed. They 
got out of the forest a long time ago and didn't realise i wasn't with them 
untill much later.

The reality of the situation quickly ticked : "All this time, i was talking 
to a complet stranger in the middle of the woods".

Needless to say that I ran my ass off, not looking back and followed the 
voices of my friends.

I finally got back to them and the fact that all of them were there waiting 
for me confirms that that "man" in the woods was not one of them fucking 
with my head.

I don't know what that thing was to this day. I might have been just some 
homeless dude in the woods. But either way, that was the creepiest 
experience i have ever had.﻿

top_comment.text:
I see a few stories on here, so I feel like posting mine. 

I remember a few years ago, when I was around maybe 10-11 (I'm 15 now), me 
and two of my cousins were staying together one night, and I was getting 
ready to sleep, and one of my cousins was already asleep. My other cousin 
was reading a book by the window.
  
So I'm laying on the bed looking out the front window (this was in the 
living room) and I see this man walk up on to the porch. He walked very 
slowly too, and he was pretty tall as well. At this time, I was already 
aware of many creepypastas and stories and just seeing this man almost made 
me piss my pants. He, for added scariness i guess, stops and looks straight 
at me. I didn't see his face, let alone anything of his body, as he looked 
like a silhouette, plus the streetlight was shining behind him. For maybe 5 
minutes I'm just staring at this guy, thinking to myself, "Oh holy crap, 
calm down, who is this?!"

I looked at my cousin who was reading by the window and whispered "who the 
heck is that?!" and she looked to her right, and right by her was this man, 
staring at me. she whispered "WOAH I see him too!" Both of us were staring 
at him now, for maybe another 5 minutes until he did his slow walk off the 
other side of the porch. Fortunately, we didn't see him again. This was a 
pretty terrifying moment that I had, and I'm usually not the one to get 
scared often. 

Now that I look back at this, I want to say that the man was probably 
homeless, as recently my cousin and I went in the woods behind my 
grandmother's house (where the event took place), and we found the remnants 
of an old shack, with a mattress, sheets, clothing, etc. (even a pair of 
Jordan's), but the clothing looks nothing like what this man wore. Then 
again, I didn't see any of his clothes so I don't know.﻿
top_comment.author: Wes “Wesley683” Horonzy

comments.text:
Here's another one my dad told me. Not really scary, but I just thought it 
belonged here since it seemed to be a bit creepy.

Back when my dad was 15 (he's 53 now), he used to work at Wendy's. It was 
all good, but one day he was getting ready to leave. His boss just got a 
new car and was offering to take my dad home, so my dad said yeah. His 
boss's new car was a brand new 1970-something Ford Mustang Mach 1, green 
with white leather interior.

They stopped at this intersection near a flower shop, and there were these 
big bushes by the road. A gang of several men in dark clothing holding 
baseball bats came out and ran towards the car, and surrounded the car. 
Unfortunately the window was down on my dad's side, and a man ran up with 
the bat and yelled "MOTHERFUCKER!" and whacked him right in the face. It 
was a miracle to see he survived. All the white leather interior, now 
coated red. My dad was quickly rushed to the hospital, and had a temp 
operation on his face, until getting a full operation. All of the teeth on 
the bottom were flattened.

Strange thing about this was, they were never able to track down who did 
it, but my dad wants to believe that it was a gang sent out by someone he 
knew prior to the event. Very strange IMO, even stranger knowing we still 
have the shirt O_o. Original blue and white Wendy's shirt with the original 
name tag, now a dingy red from the blood.
comments.author: Wes “Wesley683” Horonzy

The word "Four" in Chinese has the same pronunciation as the word "death" 
or "die". Hence the superstition with the number 4. Which is why a lot of 
buildings in China and Taiwan don't use the 4th floor and sometimes don't 
even have it.
A little more cultural background to number 9.﻿

+CJK Production It's exactly the same in Japanese. Most of the characters 
the Japanese use in their writing system are Chinese. And in the Japanese 
language, they have kept many of the same meanings and pronunciations for 
those characters as the Chinese. So the number 4 in Japanese is avoided, 
because it sounds like death. And the number 9 is avoided because it sounds 
like suffering.

comments.text:
+Jack Dooman People need to realize that evolution and the theory of 
evolution are not the same things. We observe microbes adapting and 
changing. So evolution is a fact, at least, it's a microbial fact. However, 
the theory of evolution is not fact. It is a scientific theory. A 
scientific theory holds a different meaning than the word "theory". 
Wikipedia defines it:

"A scientific theory is a well-substantiated explanation of some aspect of 
the natural world that is acquired through the scientific method and 
repeatedly tested and confirmed through observation and experimentation. As 
with most forms of scientific knowledge, scientific theories are inductive 
in nature and aim for predictive power and explanatory force."

Alternatively, Bing defines it as:

"A concept that has been well tested, and is accepted as an explanation to 
a wide range of observations."

It is not a fact; as Wikipedia defined it, a scientific theory is inductive 
in nature which means it isn't proving anything. It's explaining something, 
and is accepted as the *most* true explanation for said theory. 
Additionally, if a different scientific theory rolls around and happens to 
have better predictive power than it's predecessor, that theory will likely 
replace it's predecessor. So you can still refute the theory of evolution.

+TroutLord Insulting a person's intelligence does not make an argument 
against his points; it is an ad hominem, I word I bet you're familiar with. 
Additionally, there are plenty of other explanations for evolution, and 
fossil fuel does not confirm the theory of evolution or even that anything 
evolved, it merely confirms that creatures from times long past once lived 
on earth. It is tiring to hear you proclaim something as fact without 
logical argument, and then proceed to insult people because they disagree.

Stating that evolution proves the theory of evolution is a logical fallacy 
because it is an infinite regress, in case that happens to be your 
argument. And in case you argue that it isn't an infinite regress, I'll 
give the philosophical definition:

"Causal or logical relationship of terms in a series without the 
possibility of a term initiating the series."
comments.author: Augustinian de Juan Pierre

top_comment.text:
This is a completely true story, it happened yesterday, actually. 
Yesterday, it was 1:00 AM, and I heard a noise like a wrapper being opened. 
I got really weirded out, and looked up over the side of my bed to a 
poptart wrapper. I didn't remember even owning any poptarts. Then I heard 
the same noise, but no sounds of an intruder. No footsteps, no anything. 
I'm more of a sceptacle guy, so I went to where I heard the sound. I go 
outside my roof and peer down the hall, and see a wrapper sitting in front 
of the staircase. Not a second later I hear the wrapper sound again. This 
happens quite a few times, leading me down the stairs and into the kitchen. 
I grabbed the broom as I was walking through my house incase I needed to 
defend myself. My house is fairly big, so it took me a while for the trail 
of wrappers and noises to lead me to the kitchen. i jump out from behind 
the corner, expecting to see some retard eating poptarts, or a burglar, but 
nothings there. The only thing out of place was the open pantry door. I 
walk over to the pantry, my broom in hand. I look inside the pantry and see 
a package of blueberry poptarts. I almost want to laugh, because this seems 
hilarious, but I was pretty freaked out. I reach in the box, and pull out 5 
empty pop tart wrappers. By now I was like, "We must be dealing with a 
diabetic" and started laughing. I guess that it's my little brother eating 
some kind of secret poptart stash, so I call his name. No reply, but I do 
hear child-like laughter. But not in the living room, not downstairs, not 
in the kitchen, but coming from the poptart. I start killing myself 
laughing, and open the wrapper. I reach inside to grab a pop tart, but it's 
empty. I could have sworn i had just held a full poptart package. I look 
inside, and to my horror I find the boogie man, in his full glory. I crap 
my pants and start vibrating like a nexus 1. He looks up at me and says, 
"NICE POP TARTS BABE." His face was covered in crumbs, radiating red heat, 
and bloated like a egg placed in a forty year old microwave. I quickly 
shove the wrapper in the garbage, pull out my staff and firebend the 
tesserac into the sinful binnage, and force jump out the window. Now I live 
with the nymphs on 224 Baker Street.﻿
top_comment.author: Cmanistheman

strong opinions about spirits/ghosts and their presence or 
non-existence...One in particular +Special Agent Fox Mulder Makes some good

since even with  as far as the sciences have advanced, even the most 
experienced scientists will tell you that we don't know everything about 
this world we live in nor how everything works. For example, Ball lightning 
will usually either burn through a window screen then disperse, or disperse 
on contact with such. Yet, there has been cases of such believed to be ball 
lightning passing through screens and hanging about until dispersing for no 
apparent reason, not exactly normal behavior for something that should have 
done one, or the other as mentioned previously, a ghost manifesting? maybe, 
maybe not, who really knows, as  others had tried to say, ghosts and the

comments.text:
"Astronomers have found convincing evidence for a supermassive black hole 
in the center of our own Milky Way galaxy, the galaxy NGC 4258, the giant 
elliptical galaxy M87, and several others. Scientists verified the 
existence of the black holes by studying the speed of the clouds of gas 
orbiting those regions. In 1994, Hubble Space Telescope data measured the 
mass of an unseen object at the center of M87. Based on the motion of the 
material whirling about the center, the object is estimated to be about 3 
billion times the mass of our Sun and appears to be concentrated into a 
space smaller than our solar system.
For many years, X-ray emissions from the double-star system Cygnus X-1 
convinced many astronomers that the system contains a black hole. With more 
precise measurements available recently, the evidence for a black hole in 
Cygnus X-1 -- and about a dozen other systems -- is very strong."

top_comment.text:
I have a story I'd like to share.
I live in an eastern part of San Diego between city suburbs and 
countryside. One night, summer of this year, I took my bike out for an 
exercise since doing so at day is way too hot. Normally, I ride through the 
suburbs, but for once I decided to take a ride around the country-town 
roads.
I rode up a hill near a canyon, reservoir, and horse ranch on my way to a 
7-Eleven and I was the only one riding on that street, but I passed by a 
telephone pole where I saw a dark figure in a hoodie with his head down. I 
thought he was looking at his phone or was resting his eyes, but when I 
passed by, he said in a low (but loud enough to hear) voice the words 
"DON'T LOOK AT ME". I thought he was depressed and wanted to be alone. But 
when I kept riding up the hill, I looked back 5 seconds later and he was 
standing up facing towards me. I felt kinda unsettled, so then I kept 
riding, then I looked back again and he was quickly walking up the hill 
towards me. He walked past a street light but I only saw very little of his 
face. He had a big grin showing his teeth but I didn't see much of his 
eyes, the figure reminded me of that kid from the Let's Get Rocked video by 
Def Leppard. What was also weird is that even though he walked quite fast, 
I heard very little movement, almost silent.
I immediately peddled faster and didn't want to look back anymore and kept 
riding until I arrived in a suburban area and at the 7-Eleven. I bought 
myself some ice cream to calm my nerves, but I still felt terror. When I 
came home, I tried to sleep but had difficulty due to intense fear. It was 
just too chilling to forget.﻿

top_comment.text:
My dad told me this story of when he was about 9 or 10, hes 37 now. But the 
story was he would always lay down in his room waiting for his cousin to 
come home from her job at night, because she would bring him back candy or 
fast food, and sometimes she would try to walk in and scare him with a 
really cheesy silly cliche clown mask, but in a playful way. One day he 
decided to stay up, laying down in his bed in the dark, and when she would 
try to scare him she would see he's asleep and then he would jump up and 
scare her. So he decided to do that. He lied down with his covers on, and 
heard his door open so he knew it was her. So he closed his eyes to pretend 
he was asleep. Then heard whispers of his name, and felt subtle scratches 
on his face. But he kept his eyes closed and waited till he knew he would 
definitely scare her. He heard the whispers get louder, turn into voice, 
the scratches getting harder, then a final shout of his name. His eyes 
jolted open, and he seen the mask right up in his face. It seemed more 
scarier and realistic than usual, and had facial flexing features, but he 
couldnt scream, he tried, but emitted no sound. So he closed his eyes, and 
cried a bit till he heard his door open and seen his cousin walk in and 
turn on his light with some candy..﻿

top_comment.text:
Seeing as how everyone is posting their stories, I figured I'd shared mine. 
Before I moved, I used to live in a two family house. It was upstairs and 
downstairs but no one but my family lived there. Me and my two sisters 
slept upstairs, my brothers had the downstairs. One day I grounded my 
sister and forgetting that I had I went upstairs to go get her. Well, let 
me just say that I've always been terrified of my attic, but never had a 
valid reason to be until this night. I called out her name to tell her that 
it was okay to come down again that I forgot she was there. Well, I heard 
her calling for me from the attic, now just a few days ago I found out that 
the light in the attic went out, not that it mattered but my sister had a 
habit  back then of hiding in the room inside of it knowing I wouldn't go 
up. She was literally crying out, "Help me, I can't see. The light's out 
and it's dark outside!" It was around 10 at night. And I told her, just 
follow my voice, not approaching the attic of course, but quickly realizing 
how stupid that was I told her to stay where she was and called my brother 
to go get it. The screaming stopped once my brother approached and I told 
him to get the light. I assumed it was because she had calmed down when she 
heard me call him. Long story short, she wasn't there. She was  already 
downstairs sleeping in my baby brother's room. ﻿
top_comment.author: Lekisha Andino

bed and put its paws up on my mom's side of the bed. The person then made a 
beckoning gesture to the dog and they left through the closed door. My

been asleep. I have done some research on shadow people since I discovered

comments.text:
+Shrek Seeing as no real aliens have been sighted I'm not sure it would be 
right to assume what aliens would really look like or whether they wear 
clothes or not. Though odds are against clothes, so I can understand how 
one would reach that assumption, but what they look like depends on the 
environment they grew accustomed to and what elements they've been in 
contact with. While we can identify earth like planets, we haven't been 
able to actually see the specifics that would allow us to depict what they 
may be. Size is also a factor and alien life may be the size of an amoeba  
or larger than elephants (however large animals tend to need a lot of 
nutrients so for them to reach a size like that it would require a planet 
that is abundant with it's necessities to live)

still, it is cool to see what peoples imaginations working to think of what 
they look like, even if they aren't probable (don't get me wrong, Ridly 
Scott's alien is awesome, but why would an animal need a second mouth? was 
there something they used their jaws to hold in place in order to keep it 
still as they pierced it with the second mouth?)

Also someone mentioned before that we don't have the technology to want to 
even try contacting aliens but they also boasted unlimited possibilities. 
If the possibilities are endless then so is their technology. so what would 
we have to advance to, in order to find the confidence to make that contact 
in the first place?
