top_comment.text:
This is not a true story, but one I just made up XD.
So I was in school, did some work and shit. I ended school, Went outside 
and took the bus home. I ran all the way home as I was too lazy to walk 
normally. I open my front door, get my shoes off, take my backpack off and 
unloads my computer and stuff in the kitchen. After a few hours my dad and 
mom have came home, so we cook some food and have dinner. After a while of 
playing videogames and stuff my mom comes into the room to tell me I have 
to goto bed. I close my laptop and go to the bathroom, brush my teeth and 
all that stuff. I walk out of the bathroom and say goodnight to my parents. 
I walk into my room. But instantly when Walking in, I get this kinda dark 
creepy chill. I look around, but see nothing. Just to be sure I walk into 
my parents room and wake my dad up and tells him what happened. He follows 
me into my room, and tells me he gets the same chill. So he goes into a 
wardrobe and get a security camera that I've never seen Before. He puts it 
up in a corner in the roof of my room. So he says goodnight and goes out of 
the room. Though this chill is still there. But I remember my dog is 
standing besides my feet, I take him up and gets to bed. I lay him down 
besides me, and falls asleep quickly. I Dream about nothing and continues 
by waking up at approximately 3-4 AM. I feel this chill but like 4x worse. 
I barely open the left Eye, which is the only one seeing anything. I don't 
see anything, but I feel the coldness and chill. So I open it fully, just 
to find a black shadow looking down at me, I am first silent, so it looks 
at me as if I was weird. Then all suddenly I Barely looks behind the shadow 
and see my dad and mom standing outside the room, putting up a finger to be 
quiet. I am quiet and just Before the shadow is about to interfer with me, 
my dad and mom comes rushing in with knives in their hands, yelling with 
all force they've got to the shadow. They honestly scare the living shit 
out of it, and it dissapears immediately. So they hug me and like "Thank 
god you're ok!" kinda stuff. So I fall asleep again. Though I wake up not 
long later, 1 and a half hour maybe, and I feel the chill again. I look up 
and see the black shadow, this time with a smile on it's face, whispering 
"Now you're mine forever. :)" With a creepy smile. I can't even Think or 
see or hear that a Swat team rushes in, yelling "GET OUT OR WE WILL OPEN 
FIRE!" and it flies through the room out the wall, they start shooting, and 
I can hear kindof a scream from the wall, only revealing a bit of blood 
running down the wall. My whole family stands outside my room crying from 
happiness and walks in only for me to find out that the shadow was a ghost 
of a serial killer that only murdered people from year 7 to 20.﻿

top_comment.text:
i think the defining quote for a completely made up story is "the lights 
went out" cuz that only happens in movies to create artificial fear. In 
fact all the added crap they put in movies: scary sounds, darkness, music, 
etc serve to make that situation less frightening since its so over-the-top 
you break your suspension of disbelief and are reminded its just a show. If 
something bizarre happened in real life you wouldnt get any of that and 
because of lack of sensory overload that one bizarre thing would take all 
your attention and freak you out far more than a movie ever could﻿

Here's a story. When I was 9 my family went to six flags and me and my 
brother who was 16 at the time went off on our own while my parents had my 
little sister.

around 60 years old started following us around and such. Like everywhere

Eventually me and my brother went to one of the restaurant things for

top_comment.text:
I remember when I was younger like at least 7 years old. It was the middle 
of the night and I had to use the bathroom, so I got up and I went and I 
went back to my room. Now it was a school night so I wanted to go back to 
sleep but I couldn't. At least like 10 seconds later I hear a basketball 
bouncing. I look out my window and make sure nobody is outside with a 
basketball and there wasn't anyone outside. I open my door and the bouncing 
stops. I close my door and lay back down and there it goes again but it's 
even louder. It sounded like it was coming from the living room so I went 
to the living room and I didn't see anything, not even a basketball. Scared 
out of my mind I run to my brother's room and wake him up asking if he 
heard anything. He said that he was sleep the whole time and told me to go 
back to sleep. I made up a lie saying I didn't want to go back to sleep 
because I was scared of polkka dots ( my room was covered in pink and 
purple polka dots ). He told me that I could sleep with him so I did and 
the noise happened again. It was driving me crazy so I just covered myself 
with blankets and fell asleep. After that I never heard it again and I'm 
still trying to figure out where the noise came from. My brother still 
thinks I'm crazy too﻿

Here's my story:
I'm 12 and I think this happened just a couple months ago (like in August), 
My sisters were out, so my parents, It was around 8 o' clock so I went to 
the bathroom to take a shower.
I was getting my clothes off and I have this really big mirror, so I was 
just looking at myself, I went inside the water, washed my hair..... 
Cleaning my face...... Then suddenly I felt a hand, a very cold hand in my 
shoulder, turned around to see it.... Nothing, I was getting really freaked 
out so I started singing my favorite songs just to calm down, then I saw a 
GIANT Black gas/shadow in the shape of a really tall man, I couldn't 
believe this was happening.
I'm mexican, so I obviously speak in spanish, the shadow/gas man was there 
looking at me, until he said "¿Qué haces?" Which is "What are you doing?" 
He had this really CREPPY demonic voice I tried to scream but my voice 
wasn't working, until I got out if the bath, and the shadow was leaving 
from my window.




Creepy huh?﻿

I have a scary story too that happened to me. I was camping in Higgins Lake 
State Park, my family went to get ice cream because a ice cream shop was 
near by. Our camper was near the forest I was setting up the s'mores all I 
needed was graham crackers so I went back into the camper to get them. But 
when I looked out the window I saw this tall figure that look like a wolf, 
but stood like a man I freaked out and started jumping up and down in 
terror. The figure saw me and I was so shocked that I dropped the graham 
crackers and passed out. I woke up around 8:31 but my family still wasn't 
at our campsite I went out to see what had happened but all I could see of 
evidence was scratch marks on the walls where the window was huge paws on 
the ground and the Hershey's and the marshmallows were gone but one which 
was covered in slobber. I thought it was some stray dogs but there was a 
fence around the place so I thought I was going insane so I started bashing 
my foot with a rock to see if I thought the pain felt nice, but no it felt 
like a terrible idea but then I realized that it could of been the Michigan 
Wolfman. I went to my neighbors who looked like they were drunk, I asked 
them about the wolfman they did a mad look then growled. I felt uneasy, I 
said "Um are you mad at me?" They just nodded and shooed me away. I went 
back into my camper in confusion I called my parents but there was no 
signal, I heard the neighbors in pain then loud growls I got so scared that 
I ran to the bunks and got to the top one. Then I felt the camper shake, 
then the camper door lost its bolts and fell. I covered my head and mouth 
but I couldn't help but breathing hard and the wolfman got me THE END 
Scared much?

I had a experience of a ghost of a teenage girl who had brown hair, and 
green eyes and exactly no freckles. I saw it in my room one night when I 
was just a little boy, I probably was around 4 or 5 years old. I said to 
it, "Hello who are you?" and she answered back to me, "I'm your dead older 
sister silly, just go back to sleep."  and she smiled.
So I did what she had asked me to do and I went back to sleep not making a 
big deal about it. It was until I was 14 years old that I remembered that 
and I asked my mom about, "Did you happen to have a miscarriage before I 
was born mom?" and my mom said that before she had me at 39, she had a 
miscarriage when she was 28 years old and it was a girl.

After her telling me that I remember that I felt sad over it, because it 
was my would of been older sister. And I am a only child in real life.

* A True Scary Story that happened to me *

Me and my mom was going to work early in the morning (5am), so it was 
rather dark. We drove by the cemetery and seen a man leaned over a 
gravestone and what looked to be him sobbing or crying over it. We thought 
it was weird but just forgot about it. Then after work, we went up to the 
grave stone and it was a women who died on Aug 11, 2003. And at the bottom 
it had her Husband and Sons birth and death scription things. As we was 
walking out we noticed a gravestone with the sons name on it. And I swear 
to god I almost pissed myself when i looked at the gravestone. It had a 
picture  of him on it which was the same guy we seen that morning crying 
over his moms gravestone. It said he had died Aug 10, 2003﻿

top_comment.text:
Danger dolan, what about the true story of what happened behind the scenes 
of the 1976 movie "The Omen"?

Two months before filming the movie begun, Gregory Peck, who starred in the 
movie, his son committed suicide.


The director, Richard Donner's hotel was bombed by the IRA during filming.

The day after the film's safari park scene was filmed, an animal handler 
was mauled by a lion while animal handlers involved in the cemetery scene 
were attacked by dogs


There were several incidents with planes. When a few crewmembers were 
switched to another plane at the last minute, the plane they were 
originally meant to board crashed on take off, killing everyone on board.

A stuntman who worked on "The Omen" suffered an accident whilst working on 
the movie "A Bridge Too Far". He was standing on top of a roof, preparing 
to shoot a scene when he mysteriously fell off the roof. When waking up in 
hospital, he claimed that someone pushed him off from behind, even though 
there was nobody else on the roof at the time.

Months after filming The omen had finished, John Richardson, a movie 
designer who worked on The Omen, and his assistant, Lizzie Moore were in a 
car crash on a highway at night. Lizzie was cut in half and her body looked 
similar to David Warner's character when he was killed in The Omen.

In front of the crashed car, there was a road sign saying " Ommen. 66.6km"

If that's not a creepy true story, I don't know what is.﻿

and go into my parents room and start making screeching noises out of

cheese(is that how u spell it idk), I'm 11, so this is my point of view.

pissed myself, but then something screamed in the building which was 
f***ing terrifying. But I had my 6 year old brother beside me... And my mum 
and dad. So he had pissed himself and our dad and mum were trying to get my 
brother away, but me being me I went straight in the open door, where a 
mascot just stood and stared at me, I backed away and it moved its hand to 
the door to close it so I ran out and to my mum (keep in mind I was 8) and 
told her that the animatronic had tried to close the door on me. But what 
still scares me to this day is the mouse, which had blood on its finger, I 
still think it was a back up of one, but it had blood. Unlike freddy 
fazbears pizzeria (ive been there too, and yes it's real) chuckee cheese

the star was upside down, it's an inverted pentagram and that's the sign of 
the devil. If the star was right side up, then that's the Wiccan symbol and 
it's usually a sign of peace or magick, depending on who is using it and 
why they are.

top_comment.text:
I have two scary stories.  

The first one didn't happen to me, but to my sister.  I was up late at 
night playing video games like I normally do with my light on in my room 
but my door closed.  My sister comes in my room freaked out and said that 
she went downstairs to use the bathroom and saw what she thought was our 
mom in the bathroom, I assume the lights were off maybe a night light or 
something on.  She went into our parents room and saw our mom sleeping in 
bed and she ran upstairs to tell me about it.  I don't remember if I went 
downstairs or not to check, I think she just stayed in my room for a while 
to calm down.

The other story happened to me.  My sister and I were downstairs in our 
living room.  She was sitting/laying on the couch and she was watching that 
Chuckie movie I believe.  This was late at night, and I was sitting on a 
chair in the corner of the room, to my left was a window that was open with 
a screen in, but drapes covering the window.  The lights in the room were 
on, and it wasn't too late, just dark outside.  The channel was switched to 
a commercial at the time, and I hear breathing outside of the window.  I 
simply froze in place scared to react in any way.  After a while of hearing 
the breathing it eventually stopped.  I waited a little bit longer, and 
just stood up without any word and walked into my parents room.  I told 
them what I heard, and they didn't really seem to care.  After that, I just 
went upstairs into my room.

I have no idea what it could have been, and like I said, the TV was on 
commercials, so it's not like I could have heard the movie.  Besides, the 
movie wasn't scary, I was just looking at my phone or something at the 
time, I don't quite remember.﻿
top_comment.author: James Stine

comments.text:

in my toilet when I opened my eyes at night. I have a clear view across the 
hallway to the bathroom. But the figure looked unearthly. And it flailed 
its arms, almost like it wasn't tethered to this reality. It seemed almost 
to defy gravity. But I just closed my eyes and kept sleeping.

comments.text:
+山岡アンドリュー I wasn't all that young, no I wasn't sick.  I believe I stopped 
my breathing just to focus on the sound itself, but I could be remembering 
that wrong.  I understand the concept of not being aware of your 
surroundings, but in that moment I am sure that it was something outside of 
the window.  No, I don't claim it to be paranormal though, it could have 
been anything.  Likely not a small animal, as the windows are up too high 
for an animal like that to be close enough to be audible.  We live in the 
country, lots of trees everywhere pretty dense, and neighbors not packed in 
closely around.  Could have very well been a person, or something entirely 
different.
comments.author: James Stine

comments.text:
+xeahnort3521 Not sure about the bathroom thing, I've never seen any 
"ghosts" before, so I don't know what it's like.
comments.author: James Stine

comments.text:
+James Stine How old were you when this happened? And you weren't sick at 
all or anything? Sometimes you can actually zone out from the external 
stimuli enough that the only things you're paying attention to are what's 
in your mind; and sometimes your own breathing will interrupt that train of 
thought yet you were so gone that you didn't even notice it was your own 
breathing. Any noises we make sound much louder to ourselves than to the 
world around us since the noise reverberates in our own bodies.

Who knows though; I've experienced the sound of breathing and various other 
sounds that I swore weren't me and nobody else was around. But then I try 
to recreate the sound and realize it was me, I just wasn't aware of my 
surroundings enough due to listening to music or having earplugs/earbuds 
in, etc. As you said though the other explanation could've been that 
somebody was actually outside your window which is creepy. It could've been 
an animal too though. Depending on where you live though... At my house it 
would only likely be a raccoon, skunk or some other vermin. There have been 
cases of deer or other wildlife going through people's yards around here 
though. At my old house that would happen at least once a year! And that 
was in the city too. The outskirts, but still in far enough that it was 
quite surprising. 

I always try as hard as possible to rule out literally every single 
possibility before resorting to the paranormal theory though. However I 
also realized you didn't necessarily say it was paranormal so sorry for 
assuming you thought it was a ghost.

I really wish there wasn't such a massive amount of people who just want 
fame and fortune though and use paranormal hoaxes to do it... It's a study 
where I don't believe any of the videos, audio or anything anymore because 
99.99% of it is people either hoaxing people; or people who are so insanely 
gullible that they will post the absolute most ridiculous stuff claiming it 
to be 'paranormal' yet it's a fricken TV in the background... Since my Mom 
died when I was 5 it's certainly a study I've always been interested in as 
there have been at least a few times where I still can't explain what it 
was that happened or how it happened. But most of the times the sounds and 
things we see out of the corner of our eyes are just our minds playing 
tricks on us and it's unfortunate that people can't differentiate between 
the two.

Wow... I typed WAYYYYY too much! Anyways, have a good day.
comments.author: 山岡アンドリュー

comments.text:
+xeahnort3521 This is very much the case in 99% of people's "scary 
occurrences". I definitely have had odd things happen around me which 
usually are explainable but at least a few times were completely 
unexplainable. However, I chock that up to either being sleep deprived or 
wishing that what happened was actually real because my Mom died when I was 
5, so of course your mind will try to make sense of things like this by 
creating either a logical pattern or you will create an imaginary 'hopeful' 
scenario in your mind that it's the loved one doing something to contact 
you.

I'm not here to say that I don't believe in paranormal happenings at all, 
and I do believe there have been a few occurrences that truly were my Mom 
as they are completely unexplained to this day even as an adult and using 
all my deductive reasoning. But too many people jump to the conclusion of 
paranormal or supernatural events incredibly quickly. I am now considering 
writing out the very few experiences that were I have considered to 
possibly be paranormal though - they are quite interesting. At least to me.
comments.author: 山岡アンドリュー

Some years while I was listening to music on my pc at the desk I hear loud 
crying at the door, I look back and I see what seems to be my mother crying 
and spying on me, then she runs out and I hear the front door opening and 
closing, I go after her asking why is she crying but when I exit the house 
there's no trace of her and I go back to my desk, the whole time my mom was

didn't do nothing, she was at work. 

I will never forget that day. ﻿

comments.text:
+Henry Jackson
1) Yes they do, and they are an enigma
2) Of course mental illness and personality disorders are real. Many 
actually have been identified via neurology, although most symptoms only 
require psych examination. Take schizophrenia, for example, it is partially 
caused by oversized ventricles, which created randomly firing neurons. 
Other causes can happen as well, like drugs causing randomly firing neurons.
comments.author: Officer Jenkins

comments.text:
So the comment thingy is full :( But i wanted to share 2 things with you. 
1. Don't Black holes defy the laws of physics? And who's to say that the 
laws of physics we came up with to explain everything on earth or in our 
solar system is correct for all things? That second part is a bit meh 
though, sorry.
2. Do you believe in Mental Disorders? There is alot of debate about the 
DSM books (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) is 
actually mostly rubbish. It has been speculated that because we cannot 
biologically give evidence for mental disorders, that alot of the 
"disorders" in the book are just there so that pharmacists and 
psychiatrists can diagnose people with a mental disorder because there are 
so many of them now, just so pharmacists can recommend them drugs that they 
will buy. This is a major problem in the US, where healthcare isn't free 
and companies are fighting to make money off drugs and pills. You see what 
i mean? There is no biological evidence for mental disorders, but still the 
majority of people (i'm guessing including you) including me believe they 
exist. I have experienced someone with a mental disorder first hand, but 
you wont consider that as evidence, will you? Checkmate xD jk
comments.author: Henry BanterSon

top_comment.text:
i'll tell you a few truly terrifying relatable stories:
- no WiFi
- no Nutella
- no pizza
- empty fridges
- no battery on phone
- hearing weird sounds in the parents's room...
- being on internet until you realize it's almost time to go to school and 
you haven't made your homework yet...
- when you raise your hand up in the middle of the class only to seem 
active ( when you don't actually know the answer) and the teacher chooses 
YOU.
- when your teacher takes your phone and this is your thought: "will she/he 
look through my photos? oh..i'm leaving this planet..."
- when you see a spider behind you, turn around and then you look back and 
it disappeared.
- seeing your crush with someone else
- playing scary maze for the first time...
- when your parents say : "you won't access the internet for one week"
- when you are about to fall asleep and you imagine yourself falling and 
you wake up like crazy
- when you catch your parents doing something awkward...

And last, but not least...

Hearing popping sounds from your microwave while it's warming your food.﻿

top_comment.text:
I'm not one to believe in scary stories and voodoo magic/spells etc, but my 
next door neighbour, an old italian lady that lives by herself, is really 
strange. When I bought my old house 3 years ago, all the neighbours kept 
telling me she was really mean and the 1st week I moved here I figured this 
out for myself when she called the cops because I was renovating my house 
which makes  lots of noise with the hammering and all that. Ever since then 
I've had problems with her and ever since this incident, I feel as though 
things at my house were getting weird and my neighbour was acting really 
weird. One day I was sitting out on the patio with my dog in the yard. My 
dog started to bark and bark and when my neighbour came out of the house, 
the dog immediately stopped barking, turned to her, tucked his tail between 
his legs and slowly came to the door, while looking at my neighbour the 
entire time, almost as if my dog were scared of her. A couple of days 
later, I noticed the same thing. My dog started to bark, she came outside, 
and the dog again stopped and slowly approached the house, tail between 
legs only this time my neighbour had a camera and had taken a picture of my 
dog. I went outside to protest, as she had no right to take pictures like 
that but she went inside before I could say anything. Over the next few 
days my dog seemed really nervous, refusing to go into the back yard at 
all. I would wake up at 2 or 3am and hear him walking around the house, 
clawing at the front door, the bathroom door etc, something he had never 
done before. About a week passed by and my dog was still exhibiting these 
symptoms so I took him to the vet who said he was probably adapting to the 
change since we recently moved there and the vet said that my neighbour had 
probably yelled at my dog at some point so my dog was afraid of her. My dog 
started acting even stranger, growling when I approached him, refusing to 
eat and I would hear him more and more frequently at night. 2 days later, I 
woke up to find my dog dead in the living room. The vet said that the dog 
had died of "unknown causes", no pathogens were found, no poisoning, 
nothing. I did not assume my neighbour had anything to do with it and I had 
no idea what happened, hell even the vet didn't know. My dog was 4 years 
old at the time. About a week later, I noticed there was an awful smell 
every time I went outside, really awful like something was decaying. Even 
my other neighbours said they could smell it and I noticed my neighbour had 
hung up a cage on her patio. Upon closer examination, I saw that there was 
a dead crow inside the cage and the smell was probably coming from there, 
but the crow was DECAPITATED with its feet tied together. Its head was 
literally disconnected from its body. Over the next while, things got even 
weirder. My other neighbour, who had a 6 year old pet cat , said his cat 
had died a few days before and he says that my neighbour that had taken a 
picture of my dog, had also taken a picture of my other neighbour's cat 
days before it died. The cat acted weird, refused to eat, and the vet said 
cause of death was unknown. This shocked me as I began to wonder what the 
hell was happening. I didnt believe by taking a picture of something it 
could die. I filed a police report, explaining the cat, dog and the crow I 
saw on the patio in the cage. The police talked to her but there was no 
evidence to prove she had done anything. She must have suspected that I had 
called the police because every time I went outside I would see her on the 
patio, sitting in a lawn chair and staring at me, then quickly looking 
away. Literally EVERY time I looked up, I would catch her staring at me, 
then looking away quickly. Every time I went to the car I would see her 
staring at me from inside her house and eventually I got pissed and gave 
her the finger when I saw her staring at me like that( I know it was 
immature but I was getting pissed off and creeped out). One time when my 
dad came to visit, he went outside on the patio for a smoke and I heard 
yelling outside. He was arguing with my neighbour because my neighbour had 
been apparently taking pictures of him. I immediately called the police and 
they came and talked to her for about 30min and told me that they had 
confiscated the camera and erased the photograph of my dad. I explained 
that I felt unsafe and that I was being stalked but since she was an 
elderly lady (probably 70+ years), the police kind of just dismissed it and 
said they would talk to her about it and "investigate further". After that, 
there was this one time I opened the blinds of a window that directly faced 
a window in her house and jumped back as I saw her staring through her 
window into my house. I was not that scared at the time as much as I was 
angry that I was being stalked and the police were doing nothing about it. 
About a month or 2 later, I got a call from my dad who said he had been 
diagnosed with terminal lung cancer. This was really a shock to me and I 
was deeply depressed. I then remembered about how my neighbour had taken a 
picture of my dog, who died shortly after, my dad, who passed away shortly 
after, and then the other neighbours cat, who died shortly after. I started 
to get a little scared as it seemed like more than just a coincidence. My 
friend came over and I told him about the weird things that were happening 
but he believed it was just a really really strange coincidence. That 
night, as my friend was driving home, he crashed his car in a bad accident 
and was in critical condition. I visited him in the hospital and he was 
unconscious and had a breathing tube, they odds were terribly against him 
however, he did remarkably recover a few days later and I was beyond 
grateful. He recalled that as he was pulling out of my driveway, he had 
seen my neighbour staring at him through her window with a scary stern look 
on her face, possibly assuming it was me as it was dark and hard to tell 
who was in the car. he also noted that as he drove off, he noticed a flash 
of light coming from the window. That was when it hit me, the flash was the 
flash of my neighbours camera. She had probably thought it was me behind 
that wheel and she wanted me dead. I came back home and was beyond scared 
to go outside again. This was all too weird to be a simple coincidence. I 
didnt know if I should call the police, because there was no evidence. They 
would just talk to her again which would probably only further piss her off 
further and she would do more terrible things to me.I became really 
cautious when going outside and I soon discovered from other neighbours 
that many years ago  she used to live with her husband but the husband 
divorced her and a few months afterwards he died in what was disclosed as a 
suicide. He had apparently gone insane and eventually was admitted to a 
mental facility where he killed himself. They also told me that the 
previous family that lived in the house I was living in had problems with 
her too as they would constantly argue back and forth. The mother had a 
baby which died a few days after the mother came back home from the 
hospital with the baby. The mother was so distressed, she went delusional 
and the family moved out of the city. The neighbours that were telling me 
this were all suspicious that she had something to do with these weird 
happenings. They also said that when kids go trick or treating, sometimes 
they would come to her house and she would yell at them, chasing them out 
of her property, yelling and cursing at them. They also said that they just 
ignore her and so they believe that's why she hasn't done anything to them. 
Eventually I was too creeped out by all this and decided to sell my house 
and move as far away from there as I could. I had lived at the house for 
just under a year and I was out of there. It has been 3 years since I moved 
out, and since then I have never had any of these weird things happening 
anymore and thank GOD I moved out before shit got even crazier. Who knows 
what might have happened if I had stayed.        ﻿

top_comment.text:
One time, when I was younger, I woke up in the middle of the night (and 
keep in mind I was one of those children that liked camping out on the side 
of my parents bed on the floor, and also that the side I slept on was 
opposite the door to the room) and I decided that since I woke up, I'll 
just look at the ceiling until I pass out. So as I sat there I noticed that 
the ceiling was getting slightly brighter, then back to pitch black, and 
repeating that pattern. So I sat up to see over the bed and then I saw a 
very bright figure. It was an angelic sort of white, and it was very large, 
and blurry. A good reference would be to say it was like seeing Baymax (Big 
Hero 6) outside my door, but blurry and hard to see any defining features. 
All you could tell is that it was humanoid. After seeing it I wasn't 
scared, just unsettled, so I went back to bed and just tried to ignore it. 
When I woke up a few hours later, it was gone.﻿

top_comment.text:
OMG so just to add to the scary stories, one time when I was about 13 i was 
at my best friends birthday party. we were about 6 girls so we slept in a 
room in their house on ground level which used to be a store and therefore 
had a lot of windows.
everything went well; we watched a horror movie, went out at 3 am to just 
walk around, ... but when we came back we stayed awake for a while and 
thats when the weird shit started happening... 
the first thing was an old van driving past the house (its a small street 
so there arent any cars normally). We didnt really mind that but then a 
second one drove past the house, just a few minutes after. At that point we 
were kind of freaked out because, well, because it was 4 am and 2 vans 
drove past. But then 3 more vans drove past the house and we all freaked 
out. 
So thats all pretty lame but then the real shit happened. While we were 
recovering from the van incident and trying to sleep, the huge flatscreen 
tv suddenly turned on and played a series of noises. Since that wasnt scary 
enough it started displaying some kind of red picture, for no reason. Not 
even the normal "no signal" picture, but some kind of scary red picture. We 
all screamed and cried and hid and what not and till this day I'm still 
afraid and no one knows why it happened. The tv remote was not near us.﻿

Something strange happened to me when i was young. When i was six, i fell 
asleep watching wizard of oz. At about 3:00, i woke up at about the part 
where Dorothy goes into the tornado. Instead of the witch flying around 
there was a faint image of a skull in a hood. Then the screen faded to 
black. It then changed to a surveillance-like feed from the attic to show a 
cloaked figure emerging from a brick wall and the screen followed it as it 
proceeded to WALK DOWN THE STAIRS AND LURK RIGHT TO THE CLOSED LIVING ROOM 
DOOR WHERE I WAS WATCHING IT ALL HAPPEN. It then stared at the closed door 
for a few moments and then turned towards where the screen was watching it 
and stared at me through the tv. Suddenly, its eyes set themselves on fire 
and it screamed"HE WILL ABANDON YOU! YOUR CREATOR WILL ABANDON YOU AS HE 
DID ME!!" It vanished, i thought i was safe, then the door violently flew 
open even though nothing was there. Then the wizard of oz returned to the 
tv. Except for one thing, it cut to when dorothy was wishing to go home. 
Creepy, right?﻿

You probably won't believe me as I have no proof over internet but I've had 
a similar incident. I don't now what you call it were you're from but I 
live in a couldysack (a small street basically) but we have a tree growing 
from the elotments at the end of our strret but its about the same size of 
the street lamp. There are 9 houses in the street and on the 17th of 
November 2013 (im 14) ( born 2000) we were having power cuts very 
frequently (we never have power cuts) so we were all puzzled and one time 
everything shut of at like 7pm (during winter it gets dark early) so it was 
pitch black. But me and my younger brother and sister my mum and dad went 
out and my next door neighbour Simon and tulisa and the people opposite 
hannah, elisa came out and we were like yours out? And everyone's was in 
the area. But we seen movement in the tree where the generator is and we 
were puzzled. Amediatly we thought either a squirrel or birds. And we put 
the pieces together and it was obvious that they were the cause of the 
power cuts. But whatever the thing was it was moving alot. Like rapid 
shaking of the tree branch, so we started trying to get the things 
attention and it had none of it. My dad went to get a ladder to climb the 
tree. We all tried to stop him because we were scared. As you would be. So 
we were throwing things and nothing happened the suddenly we heard a 
growl/screech and everything csme back on. Around about 30 minutes later we 
were watching x factor and the tv went static like you said in your story 
and we heard the same noise so we ran outside and there was a thing ontop 
of the generator and my dad went over and it jumped at him and started to 
ran towards us but dashed left (to the alotments) and that was it no more 
power cuts and didn't see that 'thing' again. It looked like a monkey 
without fur but slimey and slightly transparent and was what seemed to be 
floating a bit. I don't expect you to believe me but I'm being deadly 
honest but oh well I felt the need to share my experience.

comments.text:
I lay in my bed, restless and alone, on a dark and silent night. I toss and 
turn in my bed, trying to find a comfortable spot, but I feel uneasy. 
Something about tonight just didn’t feel right. I toss and turn until I 
finally find a comfortable position.
I close my eyes, but it doesn’t make a difference, it’s too dark in my room 
to see a thing anyways. I guess it takes time for my eyes to adjust to 
darkness. I lay there, still and silent on a dark and dank night. My body 
is relaxed, my mind is blank, and I’m ready for some much needed rest. 
Instantly, the silence is shattered and my mind fills with fearful thoughts 
as my startled eyes flash open.
Knock. Knock.
It’s almost undoubtedly the sound of a fist on glass. But no, it couldn’t 
be, what would someone’s motivation be to wake someone alone in their home? 
Think logically. If someone wanted to break in, why would they warn me with 
a knock? They would just break in, making a loud and obvious noise, or try 
to be as silent as possible. Why would they knock?
Monsters don’t exist. I could give myself some peace of mind and simply 
look out the window, but I’m facing the other way and I’m too timid to turn 
my head, afraid of finding my greatest fears standing outside my window. 
What could it be though? Maybe a couple of birds flew into my window. No, 
that’s too unrealistic. Could a group of kids be running around late at 
night, knocking on windows to get a few laughs? It’s a possibility. Come to 
think of it, maybe it was my imagination. Maybe I heard the usual creak in 
the house and my paranoid mind has mistaken it for a knock.
Knock. Knock.
Nope, that definitely wasn’t my imagination. Those damn kids are 
persistent. They don’t want to quit until they get that reaction. Maybe 
some sick twisted freak is standing outside waiting for me to look so he 
can smash through and attack me. No, don’t think that. Don’t get paranoid. 
Besides, he’s outside, I’m inside, until I hear a shatter, I know I’m safe. 
Monsters don’t exist. Besides, I haven’t moved yet, hopefully those kids 
will think I’m a heavy sleeper and leave me alone.
Knock Knock.
No, it can’t be kids. No kid would wait around this long just to get a 
reaction from one, lonely guy; they’d just get bored and move along. But, 
what could it be? Why would a serial killer target me, of all people? Think 
logically. Monsters don’t exist. Don’t get paranoid. They’re outside, I’m 
inside, until I hear a shatter, I know I’m safe. But if it’s not a monster 
or some sort of killer, what could it be? Just pretend to be asleep and 
maybe they’ll go away.
Knock. Knock.
Oh God I can’t think of a noise I hate more than that persistent knock! 
Please go away! Just leave me alone and let me be! There’s no hope. It’s 
going to get in here and do sick and horrible things to me. Inhale. Take 
deep breaths. I can feel my heart pound out of my chest just relax.
Monsters don’t exist. Remember, they’re outside, I’m inside, until I hear a 
shatter I know I’m safe. Repeat that. Don’t let your fear get the best of 
you. Just pretend to be asleep. Don’t move a muscle.
Knock. Knock.
They’re outside, I’m inside, until I hear a shatter, I know I’m safe. 
Monsters don’t exist. Just pretend to be asleep and pray it’ll go away.
Knock. Knock.
They’re outside, I’m inside, until I hear a shatter, I know I’m safe. 
Frightful tears begin to drip down my face. Monsters don’t exist. Monsters 
do not exist. I begin to whisper to myself,
“They’re outside, I’m inside, until I hear a shatter, I know I’m safe. 
They’re outside, I’m inside, until I hear a shatter, I know I’m safe.”
Knock. Knock.
I can't take it anymore! I’m gonna go mad listening to these knocks! At 
least if I see what it is I’ll have peace of mind! Take a deep breath. I 
repeat to myself, one more time,
“They’re outside, I’m inside, until I hear a shatter, I know I’m safe.”
I take a few more breaths, my heart pounding as hard as it’s ever pounded 
at a mile a minute. I slowly turn my head to face the window.
My heart sinks into my chest and I’m too afraid to scream or move. I turned 
my head to find a pale figure with beady, black eyes staring through me and 
into my soul as a horrid grin creeps across its face. It was standing 
inside the whole time, knocking on my window.

your move now
comments.author: Augustscommentaries

top_comment.text:
This TRUE story happened about 2 months ago. One day when me and my mom 
were in the kitchen (she was making me breckfast and i was sitting at the 
counter.) she was at the toaster and our counter is right by the stove. One 
of the spoons used for making eggs fell off the stove. The spoon was NO 
WHERE near the edge when it fell. We thought nothing of it and went about 
the day. Later that evening me my dad and my mom were all sitting down to 
eat when we hear something fall, So I went back to the kitchen to check it 
out. When I got there the SAME spoon was lying in the same stop it had 
fallen in before (THAT SAME SPOON HAD ALSO BEEN IN THE DISHWASHER 15 
minuets earlier!) At this point we were all scared, then our dog started 
barking at the kitchen counter for no reason. Ever sence then strange thing 
have happened in the house and every night while im in my room I hear 
noises like someone is walking in my room...﻿

+MrAnimepredator Actually, it would be best if he didn't.  Mainly because 
they would either diagnose him as crazy or simply blow the issue off as a 
hallucination caused by hormones or paranoia.
+Craig Haynes There are some explanations that can help bring to light to 
the issue at hand.  One is that this "ghost" may be either an angel/ light 
entity, or it can be a dark/ evil entity.  If the presence of this ghost is 
comforting or you feel peace when this figure is around, it quite possibly 
is a light entity/ angel.  If it is an angel or good spirit, it could be 
around for reasons unknown, but it will most definitely be there with good 
intentions; like protecting you and loved ones.
However, if the presence makes you feel drained, horrible, degrading, or 
makes the room fell cold, then the chances of it being evil are quite high. 
 Here are a few of sites/ articles that can help both elaborate the 
situations and can help inform you about the evil ones.  (Copy and paste 
the web addresses to find out more.)
http://tamron.hubpages.com/hub/How-to-Deal-with-Evil-Spirits
http://freefall3012.hubpages.com/hub/Do-you-know-the-difference-between-an-evil-spirit-and-a-demon
(There are four parts of this next one.)  
http://www.born-again-christian.info/demons.htm

Now, they are a long read, but they are worth it.  I hate to sound 
religious, but if you really feel threatened by the presence, you may have 
to pray to God for help and guidance.  Remember, it is entirely your 
choice.  I do not have all of the answers and solutions, but I will still 
be willing in sharing advice if you need it.

top_comment.text:
February 2014, 10PM
I was just lying in bed looking out my window, when I noticed a strange 
star somewhere in the Big Dipper moving VERY slowly. After about 30 seconds 
I just stopped looking at it.
5 minutes later, I looked out my window again and I noticed the same "star" 
somewhere else in the sky, moving much faster than before. Now I could see 
it more clearly. It was goldish, oval-shaped, blinked light every 3 seconds 
and had a glowing light in the middle of it. It just turned unlike any 
other flying device I've ever seen and flew over the house making no noise.

I still have no idea what this thing was, and I swear to my life this 
really happened.
It might not be creepy, but it's the best I have.﻿
top_comment.author: Bobby Burkito

top_comment.text:
You have never encountered true fear until you experience "Sleep 
Paralysis". This is an experience where your brain wakes up from sleep, 
while your body does not. That's not even the bad part. During this, you 
often have illusions. Monsters, demons, dark shadowy figures, you name it! 
You see these often terrifying things that seem SO REAL while only having 
the ability to lie there and watch. Sometimes it is brief, sometimes it 
goes on for minutes. I've had this a few times myself. Once, I awoke to see 
a dark shadowy woman sitting on my bedside watching me. Another time, I saw 
scattered dots through the air like a hornets nest was in my room! Usually 
though, I just saw random terrifying faces for just a second or so. It made 
me afraid to sleep! I don't get it so much now though, fortunately. ;-;﻿

are coming". After a month passed, i was watching a film in bed with the 
lights off, and suddenly my room flung open and the room went freezing cold 
for about 2 seconds. Then, another month after, my step mum was in her room 
with me, and we went to walk out and we heard this thing say, "dont leave'. 
We went to walk out and her giant set if drawers and her cupboards all fell 
over. We have recently moved and i have not experienced this again. Thank 
god.

comments.text:
+qwyzl Most people won't believe in ghosts until they experience it 
themselves. But I know they're real, because I've had a number of ghost 
experiences that could not be explained as a trick of the eye. So have many 
of my friends and relatives. I believe them and trust their judgment 
because I know them to be sane and they would never lie to me. So while I 
can understand people not believing the stories of a stranger, when it's 
your own spouse, or mom, or best friend that tells you, you do believe 
them. And whether I believed anyone else's experience or not, I know that 
my experiences were 100% real, so that's all I need to believe in ghosts. 

As for NDE's, there are many examples of them that cannot be explained as 
imagination, lies, or tricks of the brain. For example, a common occurrence 
in NDE's is that the person is able to observe their body from a point 
outside the body. After being brought back to life, they are able to 
recount, in perfect detail, what happened while they were dead. This was at 
a time when their body had no heartbeat and no respiration, and this is 
often verified by medical equipment because many of them were in the 
hospital at the time. They not only recount the sounds, but the VISUALS. 
And their eyes were obviously closed at the time. No skeptic has been able 
to come up with a plausible explanation for that. The theories that they've 
come up with don't explain that scenario.
comments.author: LittleLulubee

comments.text:
+LittleLulubee
near death experiences are subjective, and the brain can and does play 
tricks with the conscious mind.  may be these experiences are real, may be 
not.
and don't let's for get, people do lie or at the very least, tell bull shit 
stories for the fun of it.  any one can claim they saw their dead relatives 
or friends or some ghostly being - that don't make it true. 

and some times people mistake some perfectly ordinary phenomenon for a 
ghost or some thing.  they misinterpret what their eyes are actually seeing 
and think it's some thing it's not.  
I've done that my self; for example, some times I'll see a brown leaf on 
the ground and take it to be a sparrow until I get closer to it and 
see it's actually a leaf.  what one sees is not always interpreted 
correctly by the brain.

I'm not close minded about this subject; but be fore I go believing any 
thing of this nature, I want some kind of actual proof.

When I was about 7 or something, I woke up in the middle of the night. 
Normal night, nothing wrong with it. I laid in bed for several minute just 
trying to go to sleep and I was tossing and turning. I got a little annoyed 
so I went to go sit up and I saw a dark figure sitting across from me that 
looked about my size. Naturally I pulled the covers over my head and curled 
up into a ball keeping my breathing to a minimum, hoping that if it was an 
intruder, they didn't notice me. I must have stayed under those covers for 
about what felt like an hour. Then of course me being the stupid slightly 
curious kid I was, I lifted the foot part of my sheet to see the person was 
still there. They never moved. I called out my older brother's name, 
thinking it was him but no one response. I hid under my sheet again till I 
some how fell asleep. When I woke up the next morning, no one was there. I 
actually want to assume that it was my twin since I had an incident when I 
was born called a Vanishing Twin. This is all completely 100% true even 
though people are going to say this is bullshit.﻿

Here's my story: 

I'm 14 years old and a couple of weeks ago I used to live far away from my 
school and had to take the a three buses. One day while riding the third 
bus, I noticed this guy, who looked super high and was wearing baggy 
clothes, staring at me. Eventually he asked me if I was from this part of 
town and I responded no. Then he went on talking to some other guy in the 
seat behind him. At one point he got up and went to the back of the bus and 
I heard the door open and thought he was leaving. I turned around to find 
him still there, staring at me again. I tried to ignore him the best I 
could until one point where he was in the seat behind me (I didn't notice 
him move) He leaned in and started talking to me, his breathe was on my 
neck. He whispered, "Don't jump I just want to talk to you. Riding the bus 
is bullshit. If you don't feel safe, I'll pay for you to get on a train 
with me." I thought about hopping off the bus and running to the nearest 
police station, but feared he would hurt me so I calmly (my voice was 
shaking a little) replied with a fake smile, "That's not necessary, I feel 
safe on this bus. But thanks for your concern." I think I pissed him off, 
but after that he left the bus. I never saw that guy again.﻿

top_comment.text:
Since others are posting some stories of their own, I think I'd post one of 
mine. One day I went to my friend Zach's house. He's a good guy who lives 
in my neighborhood who is just a few days younger than me and plays tennis. 
He asks me and his sister to help him practice, so we take a walk to the 
local tennis courts. The courts are close to the neighborhood, just behind 
the school and near the opening of the woods. (Yes our school is built 
close to the woods.) We practice in the courts, serving and tossing to 
Zach, and he hits one over the fence. I decide to go and get it, since I'm 
oldest and a lot less scared of the woods. I open the gate and set off to 
find the ball. After a minute, I see the tennis ball and bend over to pick 
it up, right after a grab it, I hear the hiss of a snake. I stand upright 
and look around, I thought it was normal since Zach's dad said there were 
snakes there, so I decided to shake it off. I head back to the courts, but 
before I get back to the other two, I hear someone whisper, "Watch for the 
animals, you'll get hurt like the others." I pause and look around, just to 
be sure I really heard it because I have a really overactive imagination, 
and out of the corner of my eye, I see someone. I didn't get a good look at 
him, but I focused on what he was doing. He looked straight at me with he's 
finger to his lips like he was telling me to be quiet. I start to panic and 
rush back to Zach and in the courts. He asks me what was wrong, and I told 
him what I saw. He says that it's weird and I should be careful. I ask him 
where his sister is and he said she went into the woods too because he lost 
another ball. I yell at him for letting her go by herself, but I hear her 
screaming and it's getting louder. She rushes toward us an into the court 
and tells us what happened. She said she saw the exact thing I saw, a man 
with his finger to his lips by a tree. I immediately tell them we should go 
home, using the setting sun as an excuse. I never told either of them I saw 
him too.﻿

ok, first off, dumb idea to watch this at 2 am xD
heres my story. 
my girlfriend and i lived about a half or so mile away from eachother. and 
the road i took was strait, then turned right, then left, then left again 
to make like a U and her house was a little passed the U. well, in the 
middle of the U was a grassy area that people played soccor or football or 
what not and there were some trees there at the back. we would usually go 
there and meet up by the trees and walk to the house we were going to hang 
out at. and that was where we would usually say goodbye at if i was going 
home for her place, because i didnt want her to walk with me all the way 
home, and then have to walk home by herself. i could just watch her walk 
back to her house before i went on my way. if she was at my house, id walk 
her home all the way and then walk myself home. there was a shortcut back 
to my house and one night we decided to make out by the trees at the U 
place, and we kissed a bit longer than i thought and was going to be late. 
if i was late, i knew i was going to be screwed when i got home, so i 
watcher her walk to her door and open it, then i turned and jogged untill i 
got to the alley. it was almost pitch black, and the path was only a couple 
feet wide and was a good 300 feet long with bushes and trees on either 
side. as i walked through i got this strange feeling someone was there. i 
stopped about halfway in the middle of the dark alley and listened. a cat 
ran by and scared the living crap out of me. thinking i was being foolish i 
watched the cat run behind me and out the alley, as i turned around. i saw 
him. a man in a coat with a hat on. it was about 80 degrees out and too 
warm for a coat. he wasnt moving. i noticed his head was tilted to the 
side, but in a weird creepy kind of way. it didnt look natural. it wasnt 
that big of a neighborhood and i knew just about everyone, but i didnt

top_comment.text:
My grandfather passed away from a heart attack when I was 18 months old. I 
didn't really get to know him much because I was pretty little and I don't 
remember much about him. 

So about a week after he died my mom was doing the dishes while I was in my 
room taking my usual nap. My mom said all of a sudden she heard me giggling 
which was strange because I hadn't been asleep that long.

So my mom went into my room to see me sitting up and completely engaging in 
activity by myself. She said I was laughing very hard and I would reach out 
in front of me like I was reaching for somebody. My mom goes "Who are you 
talking to?" And I simply replied "Papa!" 

Some people will go ahead and say that kids have over active imaginations 
and whatever but I truly think that my grandfather had visited me in my 
crib to say goodbye one last time. So that's my story :)﻿

comments.text:
So basically, my grandparents used to have a west highland terrier (type of 
dog) called Cassie. And I absolutely loved her.
One day, when I was six, I was over at their house, and straight away I 
went to the living room to play with her. She came right up to me, but she 
looked a little sad, giving a sort of half hearted bark and rubbing her 
head against my leg like a cat, something she did when she was upset. So, 
naturally, I decided she wanted food, and so I went to give her something 
to eat. I couldn't find her bowl, so I used a plate from the cupboard and 
fed her. No problem. I then played with her for a little but, until my 
granny came in the room. She asked me what I was doing, and I said I was 
playing with Cassie, but I don't think she was listening as she said that 
she had something important to tell me. She then said that Cassie had died 
the night before (from old age) I then looked at her, confused before 
telling her " No she's not, she's right there" 
Then, I turned around to show her that Cassie was behind me, but she wasn't 
there. I looked for ages and ages before granny told me to stop.
I still remember that, and I'm not sure if you would count it as the same 
thing, but I thought I'd share this with you anyway.

top_comment.text:
People might call me crazy but as everyone else is i'm gonna share my ghost 
story.
Ive lived in the same house all my life, same room, no dead family members 
and this started to young for me to have dead friends.

When I was about eight I was asleep in my room and it started raining 
heavily. My mum came in to close the window so I wouldn't get wet (as she 
always did when it's rain because I would sleep through it) and she started 
screaming and I woke up and saw a woman who looked exactly like my mum 
sitting on the side of my bed stroking my hair and she turned and looked at 
my mum and then vanished. 

When I was about 12 I was having a sleepover with my best friend and 
watching scary movies. We went out into the kitchen to get more snacks and 
heard a woman who sounded exactly like my mum scream, "Sophie, Don't do it. 
Please." I ran up to my mums room and she was asleep. me and my best friend 
both heard her and were really freaked out.

And Lastly, every time I loose something my mum is the only person who can 
find it. She was on vacation with my dad a few moths ago and I was home 
alone. I lost my favourite necklace, 18ct Gold with blue topaz pendant and 
diamonds on a gold chain. I ALWAYS wear this necklace. I took it off to 
take a bath and when I looked on the counter after it was gone. I started 
to panic and was looking for it everywhere. I looked on my desk and I saw 
something drop from the sky and land on my desk. It was my necklace. I 
heard a voice after that say, "Here you are, sweetie." This is so creepy 
has anyone heard of a ghost that can mimic a person before? This is only a 
few of the times this has happened too.﻿

comments.text:
Nice biased debate you have on here. You are forcing your beliefs on 
everyone and disregarding the other side. It is true that science cannot 
prove these occurrences, they are actually trying to, there is constant 
studies on the paranormal as it might be beneficial to the understanding of 
life or if there is life after death etc. That being said we cannot prove 
that these paranormal occurrences really do happen or its all the persons 
perception (there is FAR too many parameters to cover so I will keep it 
vague). I to have had so much stuff happened to me over the span of my 
life, things I have clearly heard, seen or experienced with my eyes, that I 
will never be able to prove or logically explain. that's the way life is. I 
don't try to make people believe in my experiences, plus I'm not religious, 
I'm spiritual so I'm open minded but I don't go claiming anything is real 
as I cannot explain these experience, so I cannot say just because I've 
seen ghosts that ghosts actually exist. You on the other hand say you can 
prove it, you cannot, sorry to tell you but you don't have any validity to 
anything you have witnessed, these things are only valid to you, just the 
same with myself. Furthermore ghost adventures is a media show that makes 
these shows for money, allow a few of there findings are strange and could 
very well be real, there is lot of stuff that will be faked. What if you go 
to a supposed haunted locations, you maybe see something that night clearly 
but you weren't filming and the rest of the night nothing happens, you are 
a TV show after all and this is costing you money and gaining you no 
income, so of course you are going to fake some stuff to make it more 
interesting for the viewer and gather potential new viewers into your show. 
That's how the media industry and any kind of entertainment works, the 
sooner you realise this and stop making ridiculous claims, the better for 
yourself. So no, you cannot use a TV show base factual evidence from, end 
of story.

I don't know how these ghost things work or if you're supposed to tell 
anyone about them but I believe there is a ghost in my house, it could be 
my sister just pulling another prank on me because she loves to do that 
from time to time. But it was Easter and my sister got a "Magic 8 Ball" in 
her basket, she started to ask random ass questions right there when she 
got it, she got random answers. Then later on she was with my younger 
sister and they were talking about her ex-boyfriend and the 8 ball gave 
random answers - so then she joked about it being haunted. So then she 
started asking questions and it replied with a reasonable answer, the 
really creepy thing which got them to be scared was the fact that they 
asked "Can you send us a sign that you're here?" and then they heard 
tapping on the wall then here are some things we asked it

Are you going to hurt us? - No

Are you a nice ghost? - Yes

Do you hate boys? - No

How did you die? - [BLANK] (Meaning the pyramid answer thing landed on a 
corner)

Were you murdered? - Yes

Did a boy kill you? - No

Did a family member kill you? - Yes

Are you here in this room with us? - No

Are you in the house? - Yes

Are you in a room in the house? - Yes

Are you in a boys room? - Yes

Are you in the downstairs boys room? - No

Are you in the upstairs boys room? - Yes (Which happens to be mine ;-;)

Were you killed recently? - No

Were you killed a long time ago? - Yes

Are you old? - No

Are you young? - Yes

Are you a boy? - No

Are you a girl? - Yes

Then she started asking it questions and it gave responses like "Ask me 
later" and "I can't answer right now" and then after she kept asking 
questions the 8 ball didn't answer. I don't no if it's coincidence but it's 
scary AF.﻿

When I was like 8 I was sneaking a snack at night for a chicken nugget when 
I heard something in the living room so I hid under the table but I didnt 
see anyone. I thought it was one of my cats so I continued looking for a 
snack, but when I turned around I saw someone standing there...looked like 
my sister but bigger I was like "who are you?" It just stood there and then 
it said "I always come back..." I was confused i didnt know what it was 
talking about but it was scaring the crap out of me. I closed my eyes and 
opened them and it was gone. I walked into my room seeing my sister asleep. 
I walked over to my bed then fell asleep. At 12:00 I heard something while 
I was sleeping so I tried to wake up but I couldn't it felt like I was 
stuck asleep and then I woke up seeing very blurry I couldn't see then I 
saw a girl in the hall way at night the lights where on and it was just 
sitting in the light. I said "Katy?" It turned around slowly and said 
"go.....to.......SLEEP!!!!!!!!!" I screamed to death at the top of my lungs 
and ran into my bed while it was following me ﻿

top_comment.text:
True Story:
Ok I was at a secure military beach at around 11 o'clock at night. Earlier 
that day I saw a strange out of place man in black robes, almost as if he 
was a cardinal, fully dressed, shoes and all walking down the beach. Ok so 
that night walking back to the camp sight a noticed a strange hooded 
figure, with white face and hands, walking down the beach 50 yards from us. 
When we stopped, it stopped, always keeping the same distance, when ever we 
stopped it walked into the word, over the rocky shore quiclky and smoothly, 
then back up to the sand. He just kept following us, no matter how fast we 
went he kept the same distance... The strange thing was what we found out 
side our camp site the next day, a doll dressed the same as what ever we 
saw that last night. A little girl dressed in a blue dress skipped over, 
picked up the doll, and simply said "Oh I'm sorry to intrude, he just has 
an interest in you, may I have him back". Ok so we were pretty freaked out 
right? So every day the same doll always showed up there, finally the last 
night I and my girl friend stayed out and looked for teens who could have 
been pranking us, we only heard shuffling and then saw the doll in the same 
place.

To this day I am still not sure what that thing was, or who that creepy 
little girls is, only that it was really wierd.﻿

comments.text:
+Casey Smith It all depends on perspective really. The world could be more 
"magical" than we know. We don't know everything. Us and our opinions are 
shaped by experiences and some people experience some weird unexplained 
shit. You refuse to to accept this guy's story as fact, alright good, you 
shouldn't. It's good to be skeptical. But don't try to say something "But 
it doesn't have some magical imaginary realm..." as you said it and pass 
that off as fact when you have no way to really know. You can believe that 
sure, but you're doing exactly what he's doing by "calling his bullshit out 
as fact."

comments.text:
+The Film Bros. There we go, we finally got to the root of it: "you choose 
to believe there is more to this little blue marble* in an ocean* of stars, 
than* just the normal..." So basically you just wish that the world was 
more magical and mysterious than it really is. But it doesn't have some 
magical imaginary realm to it and there is plenty of amazing and beautiful

top_comment.text:
I had an interesting encounter when I was little, actually multiple times. 
One time I had bashed my brother's face in with a toy car, anger issues, 
and was sent in my basement as punishment to wait till my time out was up. 
I looked down and saw something, which I now call "The Black Thing," as it 
was entirely back, with sharp teeth, and was extremely tall. When I 
screamed they opened the door but saw nothing since it disappeared. Next 
time that I was put in there it climbed the stairs and tore a hole in a 
Scooby-Doo shirt I was wearing before leaving. Another day I heard it 
outside so I hid under my table and all I saw when I peeked out from under 
the table was it staring straight at me with an apathetic face. Finally the 
last moment that I remember was when I was laying on my bed when I saw it 
crawl across the floor and peek over at the bottom of my bed. In order to 
help me my mother said that it was her in a costume.. However she isn't 
tall, and she isn't skinny which as I recall was entirely her. Plus I was 
physically hurt by it when it ripped my shirt, also I pushed it down the 
steps by accident however it just walked away. However it is gone now, and 
I hope I never see it again. Also living in the same house.﻿
top_comment.author: WonderMonkeyStudios

captions.text:
• From intruders in the home living there
for months without your knowledge, to aliens

that rock back and forth on your front porch,
we count 15 frightening true stories from

the folks over at Reddit, a link to the full
set of stories is in the description box below

15 - Babysitter (bondmaxbondrock),
• A story about a girl asked to babysit

some kids - she sent them to bed around 9pm
and went off to do her own thing watching

TV and getting some homework done
• From inside the basement she heard rustling

and pans falling over - instead of going down
to check, she phones the police and informs

them there might be someone down there
• Instead of a single patrolmen turning

up at the house, an entire SWAT team breaks
in and searches the basement only to find

a man who happened to be wanted for multiple
cases of rape in the area - citing they heard

someone listening in to her police phone call
• Suffice to say, she was glad not to have

personally inspected the basement
14 - Shadow Girl (Decendent),

• This father is going through a divorce
and in the meantime he stays with his own

mother, who claims the house is haunted by
the shadow of a girl walking from room to

room
• Since he and his wife share custody of

his daughter, one some weeks she stays with
her mother, and others her father - one particular

week in the middle of the night, the father
is on the computer

• Out of the corner of his eye he catches
his daughter sneaking into the kitchen, where

she stops dead and stares at him for a few
minutes - but he doesn't look at her since

he figured she'd just go back to bed
• Which she did - and when he checked on

her a while later, he realised with a sick
feeling in his gut that her bed was empty

- she had been staying at her mother's that
week

13 - Hunter (LumosTheNox),
• This one father has a son aged about 4

or 5 called Hunter - when he gets bad dreams,
he'll climb into his parents bed

• One particular night the father hears
his son calling from the next room, only,

he doesn't say "dad", he calls him by his
full name

• When the father goes to check on Hunter,
asking what's up - he finds Hunter asleep,

and when roused Hunter merely says "Dad, when
they call you you're not supposed to answer"

• The next morning, Hunter doesn't remember
anything that happened

12 - Antenna (bigsol81),
• So reddit user bigsol81 claims that when

he was a kid, he'd be flicking through his
old television antenna trying to find a signal

• One day at around 2am, he found one with
a strange rhythmic crackling sound that went

for a while before cutting itself dead
• Instead a voice crops up to whisper, "It

doesn't work. We're already dead. We're already
dead."

• It took a few seconds for the words to
hit him, but when it did it freaked him out

- and though he claims it might've just been
someone messing around with a transmitter

somewhere else, it still scared the living
shit out of him

11 - Photo (spectre_alabama),
• A person vacationing in Ithaca with the

boyfriend - they stopped near an old suspension
bridge to take photos when a woman appeared

• She offered them to take a photo, but
they politely declined, the woman smiled and

kept walking - straight off the bridge and
onto the pavement far below

• There wasn't even a moment of hesitation,
almost as if they had no idea the path ended

there before plummeting to their doom
• It's also possible she felt so embarrassed

about getting rejected that decided to kill
herself

10 - Backseat Passenger (cranklowza),
• A nightshift worker who heard a shattering

of glass at his business, a rock someone had
thrown near midnight with no other nearby

businesses open that time of night
• He finished work and left in his car,

nervous that he hadn't caught the vandal yet
- he realised he hadn't locked the car, so

did a quick backseat hand sweep to make sure
nobody was there

• After he arrived home, he pulled out on
his bike to head to his friend's place when

he heard someone cycling behind him - he stopped
and saw a crazy smiling man ride past on his

mum's bike
• He heads back home to find the bike gone

and his backside car door wide open
9 - Taiwan Netcafe (smpx),

• A netcafe in Taiwan, where the elevator
conveniently forgets to include a fourth floor

for superstitious reasons
• One man entered the elevator to visit

the 6th floor netcafe only for it to stop
on a mysterious numberless door - pitch black,

random pieces of furniture strewn here and
there, in the distance a figure starts moving

towards him dressed in a white gown
• The light goes off in his elevator, the

doors close and it resumes the journey to
floor number six

• He consulted the cashier who claimed the
fourth floor used to be a hairdressing salon

before a series of accidents and unexplainable
events, the elevators were programmed never

to visit the fourth floor but on occasion
it did - and others confirmed they'd seen

the same robed figure approaching them
8 - Ogre Man (Walden_swirl)

• A 15 year old kid sleeping in his loft
bed at a mobile home in south california,

the screen from his window sill falls off
and he thinks nothing of it, but then a tattooed

hand reaches through to feel around the bedroom
floor

• This kid jumps out of bed and pulls a
knife out, screaming to get the hell out of

his room - his dad shows up but the tattooed
man vanishes into the night

• It was later revealed that the intruder
had been living under their mobile home for

quite some time, his own sleeping bag, water,
extra clothes and a hatchet - evidently plotting

his intrusion for a while, the family unaware
how close they came to getting hacked up in

the night
7 - Basement Child (PsuedoNom),

• A rundown house in a strange neighbourhood,
this kid finds a child's drawing underneath

the stairs in the laundry room - a family
of five with the caption "our new home"

• People who stayed at their house reported
a kid's voice behind them shouting "rah" to

try and scare them, but when they turned around
nobody was there

• One time his whole family were getting
ready to leave the house, but when his brother

asked if he could take a pepsi from the fridge,
a child's voice screamed "NO" directly from

the basement
• Nobody investigated - they just bolted

from the house
6 - Midnight Intruder (kamajo8991),

• A woman sleeping inside her house with
her baby son, round about 2am when she, with

her back to the door, heard someone enter
her bedroom

• The intruder shouted "ARE YOU IN HERE?",
all she could see was the intruder's reflection

in the window glass, then he shouted "FINE.
WHATEVER" and slammed the door shut

• She phoned the police and, after they
turned up, they asked her the frightening

question "who's been living in your basement?"
• They found sleeping equipment and other

stuff - but they couldn't tell when or for
how long the intruder had lived there

5 - Black Shadow (pajamathief),
• A shadow that seems to follow this one

guy, it first appears as a hot static in the
room, followed by a smell of cat piss and

finally, a black shape in the corner of his
bedroom staring up at him

• He falls asleep the next night and hears
a metal squeak noise - only to wake up and

find a chair next to his bed, as if something
had been watching him all night

• One night when he went out for a smoke,
he heard footsteps and a black shadow approach

him, to which he pulled out a knife and watched
it vanish

• Eventually he screamed for it to go away
- and it did - when he talked to his brother

about it, he confirmed that he too had been
visited by the shadow which paralysed him

with a stare
4 - Hidden Door (LadySmylee),

• A girl living with her grandmother and
aunty, when they heard strange noises coming

from inside the walls at night
• Figuring they might be rats, her grandma

moved some furniture that had come with the
building only to find a suspicious piece of

plywood which, when torn off, revealed a tiny
child-sized door

• Inside the door was a hallway and at the
end of the hallway, a room filled with dust

and a single chair in the centre - all along
the wall were three fingered gouge marks as

if a monster had torn the place up - and the
marks were fresh, no dust on them at all

• They resealed the door and never went
back inside

3 - Condoms (gibsonton),
• A friend who lived by herself while attending

college, came home one day to find clothes
were out of place, papers and things she couldn't

even recognise
• She called the police who turned up to

reveal nobody was there, but looking through
her computer they found hundreds of love letters

all addressed to her
• Each letter ended with the same words

"If you don't believe me just look under your
bed" - she did only to find 100s of used condoms

• They could never find out who it was,
but they always assumed it was a maintenance

worker with spare keys
2 - Alien (Krayken),

• A man waiting for his wife one night on
the weekend, washing dishes when the motion-sensor

light on the back patio lit up
• He grabbed a knife and peeked through

the curtains on his door to see a grey creature
squatting on the ground just out of the light's

reach, rocking back and forth - and as he
stared at it, the creature stood up fully

• What he saw on the creature's face made
him jump back in terror - giant red eyes too

big for its face, featureless and expressionless
• It approached the door, the man screamed

at it, the lights went off and the creature
vanished - he scoped out the backyard but

he never saw it again
1 - Little Girl

• A story my own Dad once told me about
a house we used to live in - he kept it to

himself for a long time because he didn't
want to scare my Mum into making us move

• Back when my sister was about 7 years
old she'd sleep in my parents bed, but one

night my Dad woke up in the middle of the
night to see something strange

• He saw a girl that looked similar to my
sister, a bit younger than her standing next

to my mother's sleeping body, staring down
at her looking extremely sad

• My Dad called her name, but she didn't
respond, and that's when my Dad realised it

wasn't her - she ran out the room, he gave
chase but she vanished into the hallways - he

checked on my sister but she was still asleep
• He swore to his dying day that she looked

exactly like another daughter of his might
look - staring down at my mother for who knows
what reason
